review: I have downloaded tons of story apps like this one. And this one is by far the best. It's the one that keeps me up all night playing it. I made my fianc√© download just so we can talk about the stories. I don't even really mind the ticket thing. However, I really mind the diamonds thing. I HATE that to wear certain thing and for certain choices I have to spend my diamonds or my real money to get diamonds. I mean this would cost me a fortune with all the stories I read. Personally, I think locking certain whole stories would be a better option. I much rather spend my money buying the most popular books then spend it on the choices I want to do because you run into a million and that will cost a fortune. It also would set this story app apart from the others because I've never see any of them do that. I even talked to my mother in law who had this app and she told me she deleted it because she couldn't choose what she wanted to choose. It's the apps biggest down fall. If it was changed, I would say it's perfect and reccomend it to everyone. I mean heck even the tickets to read a chapter can make you money. There's no reason for diamonds on choices. You can also through in adds for all I care. As long as I get to choose the choice I want. Hope this doesn't fall on deaf ears. I love the app tho! A must download.
title: In Love...Just Not With The Diamonds

review:
*
seasiskl
I love this app but I do have some frustrations that I have noticed many others also have. In order to play, you have to have a ticket per chapter and you only get 3 tickets daily so that really limits what you can read without spending a ton of money on more. I'm also slightly frustrated with the diamonds in the same sense. You earn two per chapter read with the option to watch a video and earn four (if that option is working that day) but each choice costs between 12 and 17 or even more diamonds and each story has many choices that you are forced to not choose the answer you actually want to give, without spending a lot of money. Now I don't mind making purchases with real money once in a while for a game that I really enjoy like this one but I do have a problem when a game is so obviously a giant money grab. I believe there are ways to still make money from this game without having each choice be so costly because that makes the gameplay so much less enjoyable for the person who wants to choose a response and cannot. And the same with tickets. The choices should cost wayyyy less than the amount they take, they could still earn the money there but obviously not as much but they would have more people keep playing for much longer instead of getting so mad that they stop playing and buying altogether. There has to be a happy medium and there has to be less greed. I mean, it's not like they are actually paying these authors

title: Love the app but‚Ä¶

review:
I might love this app to much. I get to pick what the main character looks like, so I get her as close to me as I can. I get to pick her name so all of them are me lol... the best way to read a book is to put yourself into the main roll, so I do. It is so much fun, then you get to choose what happens, well for the most part. There are tickets for reading the chapters you usually get 2 and it takes an hour for one to be replenished, 
(you can buy more if you want/need) but to start a new book is free. outfits and some choices cost diamonds (which I wish were less so I could choose more options) they usually cost 12 for a nice out fit/ tempting choice or 17 diamonds for the best outfit/spicy choice so it adds up quickly, however there are choices/outfits that don‚Äôt cost, however they usually are not something I would normally choose. But I will sacrifice an outfit for a choice later. I also love the stories. Besides that the other thing I would change is a chance for a back button, I don‚Äôt know how many times I have lost control of my phone and as I‚Äôm trying to grab it again I have hit the screen and changed the story, or I put it down for a moment and my cat stepped on it and changed it. 
Also I get often that the system will not let me in please try again later, which is super annoying but it usually corrects itself in a few hours. I would recommend this to everyone that likes to read and make their own choices, however it is super addictive. üòÅ
title: Love this app.

review: I‚Äôve had Chapters for almost over a year now and I love it, I‚Äôve gotta say it‚Äôs one of the best apps for these romantic stories where you have control of the choices you make. The amount of passion put into most of the stories are addicting and enjoyable! However, there are often times the storylines and plots get repetitive and/or boring, including common tropes like ‚Äúbillionaire workaholic‚Äù or ‚Äúarranged marriage‚Äù because the MC is poor. There have been many times where I take a break from the app for weeks before popping in again to check out if any of the new ones are any good. Don't even get me started on the price and amount of work you have to do for the diamonds. The absolutely ridiculous newest update has the ‚Äúearn diamonds‚Äù section to be now only providing 1 diamond for the web ads instead of its usual amount of 2 diamonds‚Ä¶ The ads and websites we have to click to watch and read to earn diamonds are already enough work, the insane update is just the cherry on top! There should definitely be more diamond earnings, or at least have the diamond earnings be kept at 2 instead of 1. I also really miss when back then, we used to get 2x diamonds every few days weekly but now it only happens during a holiday :( Those were the times when I enjoyed Chapters the most. Anyways, these reasons are why us consumers get frustrated and ultimately want to delete the app. Chapters could definitely do better.
title: Ridiculously Expensive

review: I‚Äôve played both Choices and Chapters for the first time this week. Choices wins in decor, fashion, and verbal cues. Chapters wins in app ease of use, customer support, ridiculous plots, and best of all‚Ä¶ their rewards. Choices‚Ä¶I‚Äôve tried 11 options under their ‚Äúbuy from our partners ‚Äú bit. lol I have the other 15 options for the last idk 5 years. It‚Äôs either buy something or nope, yep. 6 surveys I‚Äôve taken and I‚Äôve only received diamonds for 2. I took one survey 6 times in 24 hours on two different devices and default browsers just receive nothing. And waiting for responses from support? lol they don‚Äôt even allow you to attach screenshots showing proof. I‚Äôd send a screenshot of the screenshot to show the time and date it failed. But nope. The ones for samples don‚Äôt give rewards they just make you click 47 different yes nos or more options over and over after you registered and once again nothing. I do love this game mainly because of one series this far but even my paying for VIP feels like I‚Äôve only gained 30 diamonds per day from it which is nothing compared to Chapters. I actually received 126 diamonds for completing the same ‚Äúoffer‚Äù in Chapters.  Choices only rewarded 11 in which I never received thus forcing me to see the books from Choices. I‚Äôll admit some of the titles are disgustingly cheesy but still chapters wins. This is my truth, maybe you will have better luck. But, stick with Chapters if you want to rewarded for your loyalty.

review:
I‚Äôve had this app for a while, and I enjoy it almost all the time! But I‚Äôve never had a problem with this when the game was like newer? It‚Äôs just that an ad pops up like every two seconds I try to read a story. Even if you press the ticket button you still get like 2‚Äì3 ads before it actually starts, it‚Äôs crazy and very repetitive. Does it almost all the time. I try pressing bc the next chapter to a story? When I first downloaded this game it was just an ad or 2 depending on which button I pressed (ticket or watch an ad) cus if I pressed ticket it wouldn‚Äôt give me an ad and if I pressed ad it‚Äôd give me one and the story went on. But now it‚Äôs basically the exact same thing, no matter what, it‚Äôs just that if you press ad you have to watch 4 instead of 3 ads. 

Also, I‚Äôve never had a big problem with the diamonds because i almost always play the user stories since they‚Äôre ‚Äòbetter‚Äô? In some way or another. But all the times I‚Äôve used it at all, it was technically for nothing and did nothing for the story or plot. I‚Äôm not saying all of them don‚Äôt do that, it‚Äôs just some of them do, and it‚Äôs annoying. As well as the ads. 

Either way, it has potential, I‚Äôve seen this happen with many games where when they start gaining popularity or numerous people end up playing it starts bombarding you with ads. I mean get that bag ig but I would like if it downed just a bit.

review:
Honestly, I feel like Chapters has the potential to be a really good app, due to the amount of diverse stories there are. However, it‚Äôs still lacking in a few things. 

1. Stories are mediocre at best, but occasionally you‚Äôll find a gem here and there. These stories pander to mostly lonely middle-aged women and fit a very stereotypical scenario most of the time. Chapters has multiple stories that cover a lot of the same tropes over and over...The hot daddy millionaire, boy next door, or your typical vampire love story, the one where the guy is a big tsundere in denial of his love for you and has an extremely toxic personality...Chapters has a little bit of everything for everyone. But the tropes are heavily recycled over and over. This app has so many stories, but lacks diversity when it comes to tropes.

2. Diamonds. I know recently Chapters has tried to make it fair for users who don‚Äôt pay, but come on...Paying 17 diamonds for choices that basically don‚Äôt matter with barely any outcome? That‚Äôs a little ridiculous. Especially, when we get very few diamonds after the stories themselves. I wouldn‚Äôt have an issue with waiting to collect diamonds, watching ads for them, etc...but choosing diamond choices with little or no outcome is a bit silly. Why not put the diamond choices on the choices that will have a real impact on the story? The ‚ÄúChoices‚Äù app does this very well by balancing this out, even if we‚Äôre spending 17 diamonds on a choice.

review: I consider this app to be one of the best interactive games for 2 reasons. The first, it really does have some of the best stories compared to other apps that are similar. The second, it is one of the best money grabs I‚Äôve ever witnessed!!! All of the important choices require you to use diamonds and it seems like every 3rd or 4th choice is an important choice. The choices cost at least 12 or 17 diamonds, some others as much as 20 or 30. There‚Äôs usually 3 choices, only one of them won‚Äôt require diamonds. Diamonds are hard to come by unless you are willing to buy them, the 30 diamonds for $1.99, get you 2 choices lol. Most stories are anywhere from 14 to 20 chapters and each chapter easily has about 8-10 choices that require diamonds. You can sacrifice outfit choices that require diamonds to save some, it just means you may end up on a date to a benefit gala dressed in a button-up shirt and ankle length pleated skirt!! The choice options are so skillfully crafted too, the free choice is almost always something with a negative outcome. Not all the stories require diamonds for outfits, I‚Äôve come across one with all free outfit choices. Basically if you don‚Äôt have a problem with spending so much of your hard earned money on an app like this, you‚Äôll absolutely love it. The game is definitely more focused on making money than providing enjoyment, which is obvious with the selection of choices given to you!!!!

review: Don‚Äôt get me wrong, I absolutely love this game because I just recently joined and I noticed they gave us a reasonable amount of diamonds to spend to enjoy the game. However, due to the cost of the good responses (12/17) diamonds. It doesn‚Äôt last that long since there‚Äôs a lot of response giving in the game to interact. Considering that I just joined the game yesterday, I‚Äôm already done with my diamonds  which means I‚Äôm enjoying the game and I‚Äôm currently wanting to get more, but I feel like the cost for the responses are way too high. Also, the fact that we only get a certain amount of diamonds and a certain about of tickets until we need to watch ads, complete surveys, and other requests to get more diamonds and those requests don‚Äôt build up as much diamonds as we need to normal play the game without having to wait a lot of time to play again. I‚Äôve read some of the reviews right now and I‚Äôve seen a lot of complaints about the diamonds so I guess this is a normal review to you guys. I also wanna point out the obvious. How the developers continue to show us the discounts of what the vips get instead of the people without the vip and how the prices for the responses this lower and how they get more better benefits than other people without the vip.
title: A little too overboard.

review: I really think Chapters could be good and for some reason I want to like it, but as of now it barely competes with other story apps like Romance Club and Choices. The biggest thing is the writing and stories themselves. They‚Äôre abysmal on Chapters, just an enormous pile of trashy smut crap. I have to stop by the second or third chapter because I feel like I‚Äôm losing brain cells. I love Poison Study but that‚Äôs by M. Snyder, not you guys. And I dare you to write a story as incredible as Blades of Light and Shadow on Choices. Good luck with that. There‚Äôs also no wardrobe feature to change outfits whenever you want like these other apps do. And of course the diamond crap is ridiculous. I might be inclined to buy/use them if they added to and enhanced the plot in any way, but they do absolutely nothing. On Choices, diamond choices add so much, and btw you can also watch 100 ads for diamonds, all at once. I‚Äôm a happy VIP member there. On Romance Club choices also matter, and they also do diamond rush events where all choices are free, so I always purchase teacups (I.e. passes) so I can read more. These apps are getting my business, and unless you implement new features to compete with your competitors, I won‚Äôt spend a penny. Maybe my review won‚Äôt matter if somehow you guys are making money with what you‚Äôre doing now, but I‚Äôm sure you could have more customers if you changed things. Just saying.

review: There is a serious issue going on with the google sign in for this app. Normally I rate this app 9/10 but not right now. My account was saved through google and I‚Äôd signed in multiple times when I‚Äôd deleted the app before and redownloaded so I wasn‚Äôt concerned about getting back in. Now, I just downloaded the app again and went to sign into my account for google as usual, except it would only let me sign into a different google account‚Ä¶one I had never even used for this app. Every time I tried to sign into my other account, the app kept glitching and taking me back to the sign in page, never even letting me put in my password. The app has had some bugs before but nothing like this, this is a serious issue. I‚Äôm writing this review partly to warn people and partly to get the developers attention because I can‚Äôt get help through the app because I can‚Äôt get into my account. I love your app and stories and I had a really good account going‚Ä¶if it‚Äôs somehow lost or I‚Äôm never able to sign in due to a glitch and I‚Äôm forced to start over on a new account‚Ä¶I‚Äôm never playing again. That shouldn‚Äôt have happened and it‚Äôs disturbing that the app wanted me to use my other google account that I have never once used for this app. I would appreciate a response about the issue, otherwise I‚Äôm afraid I‚Äôll have to delete the app for good and that makes me really sad

review: I have mixed feelings about the app. I just re-downloaded the app about a week ago, and within that week I‚Äôve come to a few different conclusions. I‚Äôve only read two stories so far. One story I finished, the other I‚Äôm on the last few chapters. I can honestly say that I do like the actual stories so far. Both stories that I‚Äôve read have been LGBTQ+ stories, which are the only two LGBT stories I can find. It bothers me that there is barely any diversity on this app. You can‚Äôt even really customize the characters to how you‚Äôd like them to look. Another thing that bothers me is the diamonds system. Now, I‚Äôve seen this complaint a lot in the reviews. That should say something to the app developers. It‚Äôs highly inconvenient that I have to either pay hard earned money for diamonds, or just choose the option without diamonds. How am I supposed to make a choice that costs me 12-20 diamonds when I only have 7, and only get one per finished chapter? Someone in the conference room needs to reevaluate their math skills... Also, the problem with that is, the story will not go the way that I wanted it to. Which makes me disinterested with the book and wanting to just stop reading it and deleting the app altogether. Now, one thing I do like about the app is the taptales. They‚Äôre very interesting and don‚Äôt require you to make choices, meaning you don‚Äôt have to pay for some choices. I really think some drastic changes need to be made immediately.

review:

review: I love this game. The stories are great and much like stories I also write. I do wish there were more paranormal stories. Specifically witches. The diamond thing isn‚Äôt so bad. 10 dollars a month for a membership seems reasonable. But even without that you can make many choices in many stories. It‚Äôs all very thrilling. The one thing I would take note of...definitely give more options for character. I feel like most people want to make a character as similar to them as possible. Unfortunately, in some of the stories, the girls are hideous lol. Women of color should also have more choices as well. What...they get one girl? And Asians get one girl? And usually there is at least 2 different white women to choose from. Or everyone has brown eyes. And I‚Äôm a very pale Jewish girl with green eyes and black hair.  So usually no one looks like me haha. I do like that we have multiple hair options though. It would be super cool if we could create a character but I understand that is difficult so just having more options would be nice. :) overall really great game though. Out of interactive stores this rates 2nd for me with arcana being 1st. Idk why choices gets more attention because I really feel that the stories in chapters are way more interesting.
title: Great game!

review: If you aren‚Äôt paying you aren‚Äôt really playing, it seems. I have never written a review in my life, but I actually have been enjoying the reading thing and the ‚Äúidea‚Äù of getting to play a part in decisions and the outcome of the story. But that‚Äôs literally not the case when it gives you three options, one is of no cost and the other two are required diamonds with is required to pay. Even if you eventually add up all the diamonds you can get watching videos (which is a measly two at a time per video that are scarcely even an option to watch, not a watch and collect at your own leisure) the options are between 12-17 diamonds. I can‚Äôt pick and outfit or different decision if I don‚Äôt pay for this out of pocket which I currently do not have the option to even do right now as that‚Äôs going to get extremely costly. Maybe if it was 5$ for like 1000 diamonds , not 60 of them for that price. After one chapter you‚Äôve just spent 5 dollars on a game that‚Äôs supposed to be free. It‚Äôs fun but not really as fun as it could be if you actually got to make choices. By the end of a book you‚Äôd be paying like 20-50 bucks if you picked your own choice which costs every time it pops up. Sucky. If it wasn‚Äôt for all that bs you have to deal with I‚Äôd give it a 5star rating all day! ):
title: Love the stories but if you don‚Äôt pay...

review: Buyer Beware. While the content of this app (the actual books) is great - from the clothing options to your choice on how the story goes - the cost is so ridiculously high and cost prohibitive. If you want to get through a book, you either have to pay money for the ‚Äúgems/diamonds‚Äù needed or register for ‚Äúfree gems‚Äù by giving out your personal identifying information. For those of us who don‚Äôt have the funds to pay the unbelievably egregious amount the creators ask for and are at a high risk of identity theft, this leaves very little options. Given this, and even after reaching out to the creators multiple times with options for those of us who cannot afford the money or the risk to our identities, I was rudely rebuffed. I would gladly praise this app if they would create a monthly subscription at a flat rate and not charge the 17 or 12 gems per choice but rather 3 or 4 if necessary. I am by NO means asking them to do anything for free. Rather, I am simply asking for a consideration to be made for those who love to read but may be at a disadvantage for lack of funds or fear of identity theft. I presented numerous business models and options only to be told to use MY identifying information to obtain ‚Äúfree gems.‚Äù I am extremely disappointed in the customer service and given the reviews posted discussing the cost, I am not the only one who has this problem nor am I the first to be completely disregarded by the app creators.

review: Okay, let me just say, I love the stories in this app. Great detail as well. But the Diamonds? Come on now. Each choice is 17+ diamonds and when you buy diamonds, they don‚Äôt even last. You would think if you bought a lot of diamonds it would last you a while, but no, about 400 diamonds only lasts you a chapter and a half! I don‚Äôt like spending a crap ton of money on diamonds so I always find free ways to grasp them, but it‚Äôs like all that saving isn‚Äôt even worth it to be able to only get threw a single chapter. Diamonds run out QUICK. And it‚Äôs very hard to earn them without having money. I work hard for my money and shouldn‚Äôt have to spend it all on diamonds that won‚Äôt even last me an entire story! There are other ways you can make money with this app you know. Put more ads or something, I don‚Äôt care, but the diamond thing makes me not want to play. Yes, you can have diamonds, but at least make them 5 diamonds or less per choice. Because 17+ diamonds a choice isn‚Äôt fair, especially with the people that play who cant spend money like that. And most of the choices, you need diamonds for. So all the stories are ran by diamonds. You can‚Äôt get threw a single chapter without them. It‚Äôs ridiculous!!! Moral of this comment, Don‚Äôt waste your money on diamonds because they won‚Äôt last!!!

review:
I‚Äôve been playing this game for a couple of years now, and it really is a generally well-balanced interactive story game. I‚Äôve downloaded pretty much all the different (at least popular) games that are similar to this one, and I will say this one has the most polished feel and best range of stories, in my opinion.

That being said, I understand it‚Äôs important as game developers that you are supported for the product that you have put out, so I understand requiring gems for certain outfits and progressive choices within the game. However, I‚Äôve played similar games where gems are used to unlock extra parts of the story, instead of demeaning you or ruining relationships because you don‚Äôt use them. It‚Äôs encouragement to use gems, to gain access to extra scenes and to support you as developers in the process, versus a feeling of getting punished for not doing so. The first leaves a positive connotation on the player (even when they don‚Äôt have enough gems to unlock the choice), while the latter that is currently being used feels more like force or punishment. 

Overall, it is a great game. With that simple shift, I feel it would be a fantastic game.

review:
First of all I do understand that you need to make some money from a free app, but this app heavily advertises that you choose you make your own decisions, but a large majority of these decisions involve diamonds. And it‚Äôs always some insane amount of diamonds like 17 when you only get one per completed chapter. The thing that irritates me the most is that every time it‚Äôs an option involving diamonds, I ALWAYS want to pick that option. It‚Äôs so frustrating. Just like other reviewers have said, I honestly don‚Äôt mind the ticket to play system, and you could definitely make a killing off of just that, or do what other apps do, throw in ads every once in a while. This diamond thing makes my blood boil and makes me want to rage delete this app because I can‚Äôt pick the options I want to.              ***UPDATE***
               I used my registration reward to choose the option I really wanted to choose, spent 17 diamonds, and got gypped. After I chose the option something within the story prevented my option from happening. Seriously, what was the point in me even spending those diamonds if what I chose I wanted do wasn‚Äôt really even an option? I chose an option to reveal something to a character, and right after the story prevented it by some bs alarm going off making it impossible to tell her. I removed one more star from my previous review.
title: Love the app, hate the diamonds

review: The reason I‚Äôm going giving it three stars is because when you play you have to play for certain choices and outfits. I think it‚Äôs dumb because if there going to give you less then they should lower the prices for the choices. Now the only way to get more diamonds is to become a VIP and I‚Äôm not paying to become a VIP when this is only a game. Also the conversion for the the diamond exchange is honestly outlandish 40 for ONE diamond. It should be like 5 for 1 since you don‚Äôt have that many opportunities to get them anyway! They raised the price of the choices to the same thing as if they were giving us more diamonds but there not! Now I have to choose the choice that cost nothing because I don‚Äôt have enough diamonds. review:
I have played a lot of story apps: Choices, Episodes, Lovestruck, What‚Äôs Your Story?, etc. This is honestly one of the best if bot the best one.

Like the rest of these story apps, you need tickets to read a chapter. However, Chapters is the most generous one. In other apps, it takes 2-4 hours to get a single ticket, and most give you a max of two tickets at a time. Chapters also has the standard of two tickets, but regeneration time is only 30 minutes, which is awesome! The timer starts as soon as you use a ticket to start reading, which is nice since some of the other apps don‚Äôt start the timer until after you‚Äôve finished reading.

The best thing about this app is that it doesn‚Äôt make me feel like an ATM like the other story apps, which are full of ads and have a many choices that needs to be unlocked with many diamonds/gems. This app also requires diamonds, but it‚Äôs not outrageous like other apps which have choices that cost 30-50 diamonds. Most locked choices in Chapters that I‚Äôve seen cost 17 diamonds or less, which I think is very reasonable. I also have never seen an ad. Honestly, this all makes me very willing to spend money on this app, which I have done.
title: Best story app

How do you Create stories? It would be nice if there‚Äôs was directions.. I‚Äôll be back for vip if there‚Äôs ever intense mystery thriller or a little more suspense or combine them , ever heard of adding comedy ?however I refuse to read just romance itself but you need to wipeout the low rated stories redo them completely why are some of them I was interested but only 5 chapters? review: Seriously, quit with all the 4-5 part advertisements. I tried to watch a video after I finished a chapter, to get the 2 gems, and I watched it and still didn‚Äôt get them. Instead it made me watch it again to get the gems. I like the stories, but a lot of them are a little to much like been there done that.  There‚Äôs nothing like reading the first 2 chapters and immediately knowing how the book ends.  And you can clearly tell that some of them are sort of knock offs from movies. For example, we didn‚Äôt start having stories with Doms and subs until fifty shades of grey was released. Now there are all kinds of them popping up. Graphics are much better than they were 4 years ago. I don‚Äôt have any problems with glitches so that‚Äôs awesome. I will continue to use this app because of its consistency. It regularly puts out new stories. Which is amazing because on a different app, I‚Äôve been trying to read a story that‚Äôs lasted for more than 2 years because they only release a couple chapters every few months. You will never know my gratitude for the fact that this app doesn‚Äôt do that.

I would have spent diamonds to say no to that. In the book Seven Day Fianc√©, all the good options cost diamonds. Otherwise I have to allow the family to emotionally abuse my friend? That‚Äôs not okay. I would have walked out and never spoken to them again irl. I wish there were better options without costing so much, and I wish that if I have to chose a non payable one that I wouldn‚Äôt be penalized for it. I also want the option to say no to sexual scenarios I would never go along with.

My review for Seven Day Fianc√©:
I hate this story. There are usually 2 options. The good one that protects your relationship from the family and towns emotional abuse costs diamonds. The one that hurts and throws your friend under the bus and ends in a bad situation with all eyes on you is free. I played this book for the diamonds at the end of the chapters. Whoever wrote this has a very greedy heart. Would definitely NOT recommend! :)

review:
I first want to commend the programmers of this game.  The graphics are good, the characters are well conceived and gameplay is fairly straightforward.  The way the app is run, however, is why I am leaving a 1 star review.  The stories I‚Äôve read have been really entertaining, but I really don‚Äôt think 1 and a half stories should have cost me $90.  And I didn‚Äôt even use all of the premium options.  The ‚Äúfree‚Äù version of the stories is threadbare and make the characters seem pathetic and uninteresting.  The only way to inject humor and spice into the stories is to use diamonds.  I‚Äôm talking lots and lots of diamonds; hundreds of diamonds.  And the other ways to earn diamonds, other than buying them, are ridiculous.  Most choices require 17-40 diamonds.  The app lets you earn diamonds 1 at a time, and there are very low limits on how many you can earn in a day.  I felt like I was paying a ransom to free the actual story.  It strikes me as being incredibly greedy.

My other problem is in the lack of oversight.  There is a story in the ‚Äútaptales‚Äù section that is a straight cut and paste of an older story on a different website.  Comments have been left for the past 4 months about the issue, but there is no sign it has been looked into.  Basic oversight and accountability should not rest solely on the players‚Äô shoulders.

This game is a complete rip-off.  Don‚Äôt waste your money on this ‚Äúfree‚Äù app.
title: Greed and lack of oversight

review: I have enjoyed most of the stories I have read so far, but there are many bugs (double faces, clothes randomly switching on characters) and spelling and grammar issues (along with names being wrong in some spots!). The story named ‚ÄúHiS‚Äù seems like it was written by a 15 year old from a foreign country who couldn‚Äôt quite figure out how to translate what they were saying into English. I was liking Bad Boy Blues, except for the fact that it kept skipping over intimate parts, but then saying later that they happened. It was weird and made the story very disjointed. A lot of the choices are ridiculous. I can either answer a simple question with a simple answer paying diamonds, or I can go over the top and lash out for no reason whatsoever for free and be highly over dramatic. I like that tickets come every 30 minutes, instead of 2 hours. I don‚Äôt like that each ‚Äúpremium choice‚Äù costs 12-24 diamonds when you only get 1 diamond for finishing a chapter. Also, in the past few days, I have only been getting 1 diamond for about every FIVE chapters, which is really annoying. Most of the stories definitely get raunchier than my other favorite story app, Choices. My husband definitely doesn‚Äôt mind being woken up in the middle of the night... üòÇüòâ
title: Almost the best

review: One thing that‚Äôs annoying is that the diamond choices don‚Äôt have much of an effect on the story. It‚Äôs frustrating that so many choices the better option costs diamonds. Wearing the nicer outfit literally doesn‚Äôt effect the story at all. Often, it seems like the story progresses the same no matter what choices are made. The only time when the choices actually matter are for the ending. While you only get 1 diamond every chapter you read, there is the possibility to spend about 100 diamonds in one chapter. This causes the reader to be frustrated and makes it not as fun. While there are some great stories on here, it isn‚Äôt worth it to spend your own money on this game. Also, the customization for characters is severely lacking. It‚Äôs annoying how every story offers different options for what you want your character to look like. It would be better if there was a more custom option that could be used for all the stories. There are on average 4 different options for what to look like for each story, and some offer zero customization at all. Also, this took up 10 gigabytes... that‚Äôs right gigabytes of storage since the stories are downloaded or something. If you want an app to take up a lot of your storage and annoy you by the lack of choices then this is the app for you.
title: Frustrating

review: This app is money hungry and that‚Äôs an obvious problem after just reading one book. While there are loads of opportunities to earn diamonds, there is no point as one story contains way more diamond options than you‚Äôll ever get the chance to earn. That is unless you‚Äôre willing to spend a third or half a paycheck just to have your own pocket sized version of relaxation. Because unless you‚Äôre choosing the diamond options, your story will turn out less than desirable and makes the stories no longer worth reading and way less enjoyable. The books become more about getting diamonds than the actual content. This completely takes away from the creative aspect that comes from reading such amazing and diverse stories. At the very least redemption codes could last longer than 24hrs or when you complete an offer you should actually get the diamonds you worked for. This is another deeply rooted flaw with this app. You will waste your time completing ‚Äúfree‚Äù diamond offers. More than half of them still want you to make a purchase and they don‚Äôt pay out. I‚Äôve completed dozens of offers from 1 diamond to 500 and still haven‚Äôt seen a single one. Just don‚Äôt waste your time or your money there is no point in trying to read anything on this app unless you feel like selling a kidney.

review:
I really enjoy the stories and have gone through with paying & without, it‚Äôs a good mix in order to make it through a story. I have two suggestions that would make the app even better: re-live and re-do.
The re-live option would be free (can use diamonds to unlock but don‚Äôt make it a crazy amount‚Ä¶ 50 sounds good). With this you are able to re-live a story you have completed but you cannot make new choices. When a decision time comes you would only be able to pick the choice you did last time you played the story. It would be like watching a home movie. Also, it would give someone like me who likes to re-read a favorite story that opportunity. Right now, if I try to re-play a favorite it just goes to the last chapter and says ‚ÄúEnd‚Äù.
The re-do option would be a pay option ($5.99 or $9.99). This would wipe your selections clean so you could pick a different path: maybe be the good girl (or the bad one) the second time around, pick lover A over lover B, take that leap of faith that you didn‚Äôt, etc.
Thank you for the stories and I look forward to playing through more.
title: Suggestions

review:
So I LOVE the stories! They are by far the best stories compared to others. I get lost in them every time, not to mention the graphics that follow with the story are stimulating and rendered well. I am embarrassed to admit how much money I have spent on this app. I am trying to take advantage of free advertisements for diamonds but usually they are for 1 or 2. Without premium choices you are not going to get the story you ‚Äúreally‚Äù want. Each book could easily come out to paying $20-$60 per book, which is insane. That is the price of paying for a full 50 hour game haha (one book should not cost the same price as Zelda BOTW). I would actually rather pay full price per book if it meant I could choose whatever choice I wanted! Honestly, as much as I hate to admit it, I will not be able to keep this game forever because I simply can‚Äôt justify the price. It is a very clever scheme.

I would love for the creators to consider a ‚Äúbuy the book‚Äù altogether option. I would easily pay $10-$20 per book if it meant that I owned the story. After purchase I could make whatever choice I wanted as well as re read the story whenever! They could also keep an option to pay as you go for others.
title: 5 star quality, price for choices are insane.

review:
Do not play this app (game?) unless you want to waste money and be frustrated. The only ‚Äúdecisions‚Äù you get to make for your character for free are things like ‚Äúdo you say ‚Äòhi,‚Äô ‚Äòhello,‚Äô or ‚Äòwhat‚Äôs up?‚Äô‚Äù Most decent decisions cost 17 diamonds. You can earn 5/day from watching 5 ads, and you earn one at the end of a chapter. But there are SEVERAL decisions to make per chapter. So to make the decision they know the reader wants, it will take you 3+ days of watching ads. It would take you weeks to finish one chapter that way, so I was a sucker and bought diamonds. I‚Äôm so annoyed at myself, but I‚Äôm a Jennifer Armentrout fan and was excited Obsidian was on here. Some examples of choices are‚Äîyour friend looks upset. Ignore her or tell her to get over it, or for 17diamonds ask her what‚Äôs wrong.  I went through most of the story having my character act like a complete witch with no redeeming qualities because those were the only free choices. And where‚Äôs the fun in that. 
The idea is neat, but the execution is horrible. If anything buy stock in this app because these people have to be making a ton of money. It would seem less of a rip-off if you could choose to watch more ads to earn diamonds or something. 
What I would recommend is scroll through the stories to see if any grab your attention, then just read the actual book it‚Äôs based on. 
YOU‚ÄôVE BEEN WARNED!üëÜüèª
title: HORRIBLE!

title: Love this app but.....

review: I find it very troublesome that the white main character options are drawn better than the POC main character options. There‚Äôs always something off, whether it be the facial harmony, the hair options, etc. This is troublesome, it‚Äôs almost as if there aren‚Äôt POC artists within this company. The Latina, Black & Asian options have bigger heads, the same skin color, facial features that don‚Äôt look as harmonious, etc. It‚Äôs like they‚Äôre rushed. Maybe they‚Äôre done as an after thought? It‚Äôs simply not fair. And you can see it in the latest book Chained to My Prison Guard. When are the POC going to get new MC choices? You do it often for the White options. We‚Äôre constantly recycled with the same options. And don‚Äôt get me started on the hair. If you‚Äôre going to do box braids so some scalp & you can have tightly coiled hair that‚Äôs actually‚Ä¶hold on don‚Äôt faint when I tell you‚Ä¶long *gasp*, I know who knew it was possible!?!? It‚Äôs 2023, past the half point at that. Do better! And include some variety in your Asian selection, not every Asian looks Japanese, Korean or Chinese. This is ridiculous. For all the diamonds that we have to buy, which is even more ridiculous but that‚Äôs another story for another day, we should be getting premium graphics especially if I‚Äôm paying premium money. Super disappointing!!!!

review: I have really enjoyed the stories on here, compared to similar apps with in-game purchases. However, I‚Äôm not fond of the micro-transactions system. A more reasonable price would be $5-10 for one whole story (which is more or less the same amount you would spend on the novel they are often based on). If the developers weren‚Äôt gouging readers for money, I think they would end up making more money as consumers are more likely to spend if they are getting a better value for their money. You can earn virtual goods (‚Äúdiamonds‚Äù) by watching ads, but the diamond spending choices crop up so often that it is difficult for the readers to immerse themselves. By the time you earn or spend enough, you‚Äôre no longer sucked into the story and less inclined to continue your patronage. I‚Äôve cut myself off at spending $40, which is relatively the amount I would spend on an entire PC or console game, and certainly way too much to spend on just one app- especially considering the meager amount of content $40 will unlock. Inevitably, I‚Äôm going to revert to reading regular old romance novels, but... hopefully (but doubtfully), in taking my time to provide this feedback, I‚Äôve inspired the developers to take heed.
title: Great stories, overpriced.

review: This game is creepy and weird. I downloaded it as a joke because I kept getting an ad for it on a puzzle game. and every story pushes for you to be physically intimate with the love interest. While I can understand it is a ‚Äúsmut‚Äù style game, it definitely plays into some weird themes. That being the first story I played having main character knocked out and taken to a remote cabin where the love interest continuously pushed for physical intimacy. The gems you are given to pay for more options only pay for uncomfortable options and a lot of times it seems you cannot avoid the uncomfortable or weird options. This game is very strange and to know I was getting ads for it playing puzzle games and knowing that kids are downloading games like this makes me sick. There aren‚Äôt enough restrictions for games like these. I would be really upset to know young children were reading stories that perpetuated the sexualization of school girls or being knocked unconscious and kidnapped. Being kidnapped and/or sexualized in school is not something to be excited about. It even involves a steady theme of your ‚Äúlove interest‚Äù waiting until you‚Äôre ‚Äúold enough‚Äù to pursue you. I hope they put restrictions on this game. The themes that occur are overall not how young girls should get excited about romance.
title: Creepy and weird

review: I want to give this full 5 stars but I have one issue with this game, how you have to buy diamonds to make choices. And when you download you are given a few diamonds but it‚Äôs not even enough. It will be 20 diamonds for 1 choice but then you pay 4.99 for 40 more diamonds which will be used up in 2 choices. This for me is the biggest downfall of this game. Aside from that I‚Äôm so in love with this game. I like how the stores go, I like the build up of either which way you wanna play and then it‚Äôs basically always can be 2 stories in 1 if you switch up choices later on. I also really like how we can customize our characters so specifically all the way up to the color of their eyebrows. It‚Äôs so cool( it‚Äôs definitely a good time pass. All I really have to say negative about this game is the whole diamond thing! No matter how much you buy you run out and then some choices are 30 diamonds 20 diamonds. That‚Äôs insane I understand 5 diamonds for an outfit change etc. Also I wish the characters in the game can do little things to earn diamonds for free, besides that it‚Äôs a fun game and should be downloaded!

review: I really love this app. I think it‚Äôs a great app with lots of fun stories to choose from. The only thing that I don‚Äôt like about it is the fact that the choices with diamonds cost so much. Honestly, the diamond choices should only be like 5-10 diamonds instead of like 19. Also the outfits should be lowered in price too. I do like how there are options like watching videos to get diamonds and sometimes you get diamonds during the story or how you earn a diamond after every chapter. Also, i think it should change a little bit in the random emotions thing. Sometimes if you don‚Äôt spend diamonds, the other choice you make gets the characters mad at you and it‚Äôs really annoying for the reader. And the waiting time for the tickets was nice because it was only 30 minutes for each ticket, but with the new update, it‚Äôs like 2 hours. Please go back to the original. I really love this game, but I‚Äôm kind of sad because with the new update, the app won‚Äôt open because it can‚Äôt connect to the server when it always could before. Overall it‚Äôs a great game, here could just be a few things fixed.
title: Awesome

review:
I‚Äôve been playing for awhile and I even started my own story! I absolutely love this game however, its hard to access many things within it. For example, its hard to find someone‚Äôs story without scrolling through the entire taptales. I wish there was a search bar. Also it would be great to have access to people‚Äôs profiles so it can be easier to find their stories or chat with them directly. I realized that authors cannot start a conversation and I would love that feature to maybe update the readers or tell them `thank you‚Äô. 
With the stories that I‚Äôve written. There were certain words that were prohibited, such as, ‚Äúspoon‚Äù. It was weird and I couldn‚Äôt understand why. I also couldn‚Äôt understand why curse words and sexual words were prohibited in the taptales and were accepted in some chapters stories. 
I definitely wish receiving diamonds were easier. I was slightly disappointed when I couldn‚Äôt receive diamonds for completing certain achievements. They just unlocked something and that‚Äôs it. 
Overall, I love the game. It is better than other games like this with its story quality and content, and the appearances of the characters. I hope the next update will be great.
title: Love this game but..

review: I love reading and I‚Äôm a writer as well so I thought I‚Äôd give this a try after seeing it in ads. Well the reviews are misleading. After about a week or so of playing this game I realized some things about this app. One is that for the good stories you have to have a lot of gems saved up to be able to make even some decent choices. You can watch adds to earn gems but you don‚Äôt get very many and the ads are about 45 seconds. A lot of the stories are similar. There‚Äôs a rich person, someone who falls in love with them, and a crazy person. The most diverse are the paranormal ones. Hardly anything that‚Äôs relatable. A lot of the time you either have to choose a choice you don‚Äôt want or spend money for gems for the other choice. And some of those choices are even more than the rest of the story. I was somewhat content with having some stories end the way they did but others just made me angry because I felt like I really didn‚Äôt get a choice. There are also grammatical errors in every story I have read. Hire a proof reader or something. Some of the story ideas are good ones but the best this going for this app is the graphics. Overall this app is leaving me quite disappointed and I‚Äôm not sure how long I want to play on this app anymore.
title: Disappointing

review:
To be honest, I just started playing the game and I immediately got hooked into the first story right off the bat because I felt like I was in one of my romance books. Except I really felt like I was in the shoes of the main character because I was choosing answers that actually sounded like my personality. And I really loved that part of this app and how well the stories are developed as well. I also thought that the variety in appearance and the beautiful graphics made this app stand out from others with the same choose your story idea. 
There are two things that frustrate me, the VIP pass offer, offers a DISCOUNT in gems for a LIMITED time and it starts at 30%. So I would have to pay for a pass to pay for diamonds to make choices that of course I want to make because it‚Äôs usually the better option out of the two. The second part that frustrates me is the fact that the app developers are clearly not taking in the reviews and suggestions that their PLAYERS are sharing. If almost all the reviews discuss issues with the diamonds and state that they wouldn‚Äôt mind paying for bundles or each story on its own, then I personally can not understand how there have been no changes made to this part of the game.
title: No changes in diamonds

review:
Totally disappointed by how much Diamonds cost. Hey Chapters, did you know Netflix charges a rate of $8 a month to stream any movie? That choice is what made Netflix used by so many to become a long-lasting company. They made more money overall doing it this way then over-charging single users because it caught on like wildfire. Do you want to: a) overcharge single users causing them to delete the app (costs 17 diamonds) or b) become a long-lasting company by charging fair prices to more loyal users? 

I agree with the previous comment, I‚Äôd rather pay a flat fee to choose a book and be able to make the choices I want in a game. Sick of having to choose the free choices (after spending $15 to buy diamonds to make choices at all) and giving up on the book because the plot line is not going as I would‚Äôve chose. Looks like I‚Äôll be leaving the app and heading to the library. Would I pay a monthly subscription or book-by book price? Yes, I would. I like everything else about this app. In order to have an all-access pass to these books it can cost upwards of $45 or $50.... Stupid. Neither party profits from this. Chapters, it‚Äôs your choice. (And we promise you, we won‚Äôt charge diamonds for either choice you make)
title: Disappointed by Diamonds

review: A lot of these stories are written by authors that don't let the player choose what their character will look like, even though the character's background has very little or nothing to do with the story. I'm noticing a pattern and I don't like it. A lot of the stories are about s*x and/or love crazed female characters that seem to find the male love interest "hot" no matter what; even though the male love interests aren't even attractive a lot of the time. You go through darn near the whole story only to have to PAY gems to say yes or be "official" with the love interest you were forced to date and/or sleep with the entire story. A lot of the authors seem young, immature, and/or naive because a LOT of the characters and relationships that take place are severely UNHEALTHY. Chapters needs to do a better job of picking authors that don't just write about white characters and their stories/relationships, and stop picking authors that have horrifically unhealthy views of relationships and that write for teens. Also, pick which age demographic you want to write for. One story, "Twice the Growl" was EXTREMELY inappropriate for anyone under legal age. Do better, Chapters. The book, "The Red" is the most offensive thing I have read in a while. The entire book is disgusting.
title: I Can't Take It Anymore

review:
I love reading books on this app. There‚Äôs a variety of stories for each individual person. I can remember a time when readers could read stories without stars. However, since the stars option has been added, it makes it more difficult for readers to be able to read the stories they are interested in. Most every day Citizens, cannot afford to pay a boatload of money just to read a story they‚Äôre interested in.

Additionally, chapters does not have a way to earn or collect stars throughout the app. Every day citizens are having to buy stars with their own hard earned money. It is unfair to the reader to get interested in a story and not be able to finish it, because the author added stars to it. It‚Äôs also unfair to the reader to find a story that they are truly interested in but not be able to read it because they can‚Äôt afford to buy stars every couple of days just to read a book. Something needs to be done here to correct this because authors are losing readers due to this stars option.
title: I love this App Except the Stars

review:
Love be the app and love the game but the diamonds are costly and it can get expensive out of pocket. The stories are great and intriguing but this app has its flaws. I spent money to get vip it took my money and froze up i ended up deleting the app and now I‚Äôm starting over in shiv I feel I deserve my money back because it didn‚Äôt give me the diamonds that I thought I would be getting I‚Äôve read lots f reviews and all the readers are saying the same thing they can‚Äôt make their own choices without paying the price. Lesson learned on this. Sticking to what I can afford. The stories are great but there needs to be another solution and alternative to what can be bought especially when it comes to the outfits they should be a given. I understand the author has to make money but why not allow us readers to buy the book? It would be a lot more readers if this were the case and I would definitely recommend it to my friends. Hope this reaches out to the makers of the game and the authors. Mean a lot to your loyal players.
Thanks. 
Stalky.

review:
I love this app. I‚Äôve been using it for a couple of years now. 
First, a request. This app is great, but it is a strain on the eyes at night for IOS users that enjoy the dark mode that most apps support, but Chapters does not. If this can be accommodated that would be awesome and our retinas will be thanking you.
For my review of the app:
As a college student I love getting away from life for a bit to read these stories. It‚Äôs taken me a long time to get to a balance between my wallet, and my impulse to get more diamonds to make it through the stories. In order to effectively do so I maintain a premium membership so I can have more diamonds for choices that require them during breaks and times I‚Äôm able to read more without procrastinating on other things. During the semesters I let my membership fall to a free standard membership and mainly collect diamonds for the couple of stories that I will continue to read during that time.
Hopefully this was helpful, your wallets will be thanking you.
title: Love the app, but Wish dark mode was supported

review:
I love this game! But the whole üíé thing for the better choice answer is a cockblocküôÑ I know they have to charge some money but when you have to pay gems for almost every answer it‚Äôs frustrating and very expensive, because you also have to pay for tickets,hairstyles,outfit‚Äôs,etc . That‚Äôs if you want the response from the story that you‚Äôre looking for. The story that I‚Äôm on, I always feel as if my date is going to leave me because of the awful,rude 
,wishy-washy free answers. I‚Äôm glad the other character is understanding and always comes back even though the answer given would have been unacceptable in real life and caused a major argument. I‚Äôve had to turn down sexual situations, calling the relationship official, and sending home the other character drunk because I don‚Äôt have the 17 gems every answer it wants. Which makes me want to throw my phone across the room. I hope the creators of this game would take this into consideration and give more answer options other than the ones you have to pay for making gameplay fair.  

Thank you! üôÇ

review: Here are the pros: the stories are amazing. there is a story for everybody. Never boring writing. Different genres. But the cons... its hard to actually enjoy the stories whenever you want unless you're willing to spend real money. Please make it an option that we can watch ads for premium choices instead of spending all this money. I would never uninstall this and recommend fo friends but I find myself uninstalling often because this seems like a money thirsty app. I understand you have to support the artists and writers but I think it would be good to have that as an option because you earn money from it right? Its better that someone who never would buy a pass would watch an ad. I also understand there is already an option to watch ads to get 2 diamonds but cmon really? 2 diamonds? That's barely anything and the premium choices cost like 20 diamonds sometimes! The people who are loyal to the game should get something for even logging in. The team for this game is holding this game's potential back... I hope something changes.

review:
This is so much fun and I love that you can choose your own path, your own adventure! When I was younger, I remember how I loved these ‚ÄúChoose Your Own Adventure ‚Äú books . They were so much fun and it was so neat how you would read a part and then you would come to a point where you would have to make a choice between two or three choices. Each one would lead you down a different path and would lead you to different adventures!! 
I think this is sooo much fun and I just love the way you are like writing a book with your choices in it instead of the author‚Äôs choices!!!
My only regret is that it can get quite expensive! You have to pay with ‚Äúgems‚Äù in order to be able to get to the next chapter or sometimes to make a choice. Normally I would say that is ridiculous and would not spend the money. However, once you get into these ‚Äúbooks‚Äù you ( or at least I am!!!) will be unable to say no!!! So beware!!
 If you think you can spend the money, then I say ‚ÄúENJOY!!!‚Äù You make the choice.......
title: I love this!!

review: Lately this app has been freezing a lot. It also doesn‚Äôt allow the videos to play for free diamonds by saying video not available repeatedly!!! So when you do get a video to play, there is either a delay in receiving the diamonds or not receiving them at all. The similar things happened here recently with a purchase of 550 diamonds I purchased tat showed me purchasing them but they didn‚Äôt actually add to my account it just said payment successful but those diamonds never showed up on my account. I emailed about this but I‚Äôve only got showed a receipt for them being added but like earlier explained the purchase went through but there was a delay and they never were added to my account. As a customer this is very upsetting that I‚Äôve purchased something that didn‚Äôt show and customer service wouldn‚Äôt do anything further then by showing me proof that I received those diamonds. I love these stories and spend too much money on these diamonds and tickets so it‚Äôs upsetting to see that a company making money off of us wouldn‚Äôt just give the diamonds I purchased that I didn‚Äôt receive for whatever reason!!! review: Everything about this is great minus the gems and golden tickets. It‚Äôs absolutely ridiculous how much they charge for gems and how frequent you have to use them in the story. And of course there‚Äôs always the other option in the dialogue that doesn‚Äôt cost gems but go figure it‚Äôs usually the undesirable choice. Then there‚Äôs the golden tickets. You need them to play the story. Once you run out you have to buy more or wait an hour and half. Which ok I was fine with waiting but then when I went to open up the app I saw that the time never went down. Come find you have to keep the app open for an hour and half in order to get a golden ticket. So they expect you to not use your phone for an hour and half just so you can get one measly golden ticket. I had to delete this app. It gets easy to spend money on gems, these stories are addicting and hot. Y‚Äôall need to lessen the need for gems in choices, or lower the amount of gems needed for a choice, I mean come on 17 gems for one choice, the timer should be going down for the golden ticket even if the app is not running. But until then I‚Äôm not messing with this app again. Beware people who play this. You‚Äôll waste a lot of money.
title: Expensive

review: I love this app but I have to give it a bad rating because of the sheer difficulty of being able to make any decisions without spending tons and tons of diamonds or money. I don‚Äôt have $1 million to spend on this game. You used to be able to get one gem every 12 seconds and earn quite a bit to make decisions. Now you get two gems, you wait two minutes to earn another and you can do this like 10 times a day. It‚Äôs not nearly enough to make any decisions that will give you a good exciting story. Also today, I tried to watch the videos to get the gems and the videos wouldn‚Äôt even play. If you make the decision to be intimate with the main character, you shouldn‚Äôt have to make another decision down the line about whether you are still going to be intimate with them two seconds later. Why do we have to pay money for all the good outfits every single time? It‚Äôs just so expensive. It‚Äôs frustrating because it‚Äôs a really great game and great stories, there‚Äôs great artwork and scenery, but you just can‚Äôt get a hold of doing anything without having to spend diamonds on it. I‚Äôm not a millionaire and don‚Äôt have money to burn.
title: You can‚Äôt even play without spending a lot of money

review:
Dear Chapters, 

This game has beautiful artwork for the book covers and I like how smoothly everything transitions from character to character when they are having a conversation. I really enjoy the amount of stories that you have on this app and I can‚Äôt wait to dive deeper into each of these stories. I love that you have a reward system based on specific types of achievements that you can earn that will give you diamonds and I like that you can watch ads after each chapter you finish and you the wait time for watching a new ad for a reward of two diamonds is not that long. However, there is two things that I would offer the players of this app. The first thing would be lowering down your wait times for each ticket to at the most 1 hour and at the least 45 minutes, this will be a nice feature to have especially during these tough times during quarantine because I have noticed that a lot of people have been migrating to story apps such as this one to live a life in a main character‚Äôs point of view, so they can get a bit of a sense of normalcy. The second thing I would suggest is to add a system where there is a wheel that is offered at least once every day so people can win things that will give them things such as free diamonds, free tickets, a free story for the day, and even maybe a VIP Membership for a week if they get lucky enough. If you have taken the time to read this, thank you so much! 

Sincerely,

-Ash
title: This Game is Special

review: I am really enjoying the story. I‚Äôm on my first one, I have already linked my account, and found what I can in earnable diamonds, watch the ads as they pop up in hopes to collect diamonds, but really the charge of 17 diamonds to make a basic choice but only to receive 2 diamonds for watching a 30 second ad is just a bit much. I am a mom with 6 kids. I read as a way to relax and I love the idea of making choices to see how the books will go, but I‚Äôm already on a budget and I refuse to spend money to read a book. I can spend the same amount of money and buy an actual book and maybe I won‚Äôt have the choice to help the story line along, but I won‚Äôt have to keep spending money to enjoy the story. I mean I had 80 diamonds and basically used them in less than 30 minutes. Now if I want to enjoy the story I either have to choose options that I don‚Äôt necessarily care for or I have to spend money. It‚Äôs super frustrating. Either add more options to earn more diamonds or lower the cost of choices... or better yet do both and watch the amount of downloads skyrocket. Just sayin‚Äô

review: Love the story lines. They can be addictive. However, too much waiting for things and it gets expensive. You have to wait to watch ads to add only 2 diamonds and sometimes, they don‚Äôt work. You have to WAIT for almost 4 hours for tickets. You have to WAIT 24 hours to let friends give you more diamonds after you ONLY get 10. You have to WAIT 15 hours when you meet your diamond ad quota. You have WAIT a week for chapters to be released. If they have a series, you have to WAIT on a cliff hanger. For instance, I have read the Lux series and there‚Äôs supposedly a 3rd book but who knows when that will happen. Personally, diamonds should be used for releasing extra chapters and outfits, especially if you have to WAIT for tickets to read chapters and it takes FOREVER to get tickets. It gets too expensive and people do start to get bored. I‚Äôm seriously waiting for the LAST chapter for one book and 3 more chapters for another book and there really isn‚Äôt much else I want to start because it will cost me a small fortune for diamonds. It might be easier to actually FIND the real books and delete this app.

review:
Decent so far. It's always frustrating when you want something that's fun, really well written, and easy to access. You've got one of those. I knew getting into this that these stories probably wouldn't be masterfully done, and that's cool, a little steamy fun isn't always gonna be an intellectual exercise, nor should it always be.  But the access isn't easy either. Cost aside, you've got tickets and coins and diamonds and i really dont know what else, and there's a payment model to get more of whichever one of these, like many apps, but it's a frustration how much you need to actually just sit down and read. This is probably an app i will not use often, maybe check in when I remember to to save up whichever payment item i need to read, and then every once in a while binge a single story, if i'm even able to do that. i'm fine with ads, but when i go to watch them to get more, it says to try again later, soooo, i guess this is the method i'll go with instead.

as always, reading in apps is just not as great as what you can find in the library or just like, Ao3 for free anyway. *big shrugs*

review: It is a really good app, it engages you into the story; but it makes you pay with or for diamonds constantly. The choices that are offered seem to constantly ask for diamonds. Even if you do choose pay diamonds for one choice, it does not always give you the full choice, it stops 1/3 of the way and asks for more diamonds if you want to keep on continuing the choice. It is not only about that though, it is like a lot maybe even majority of choices are choices with diamonds. I want to save my diamonds for the best choices, but sometimes I run into a choice to tempting to rest; Unfortunately, it either takes a 360 degree turn and does not give me the choice, just some measly words or a preview so close to the choice it leaves me dumbfounded that I spent diamonds on a choice that just backfired. The other thing that happens is like I said you can‚Äôt get the full choice without paying the diamonds. It does not always do this, but the choices it does follow and you can enjoy are weak or not as big. I AM NOT ENJOYING MYSELF ON THIS APP: I keep on pondering constantly what is the best choice to spend my diamonds on or that this game is unfair and unsatisfying.

review: Honestly I enjoy the app and most of the stories but the gems are still an issue. If you don‚Äôt want to spend money, good luck finishing a story with any gem options. It‚Äôs great that they brought back the ability to watch ads for gems but honestly? Why make everyone wait 2 minutes between ads when you only get so many a day? Either get rid of the wait time or get rid of the limit on how many ads you can watch a day. Also having 3 back to back 17 gem options in 2 minutes of part of a story is bordering greedy. It‚Äôs already insane that the top choices cost so much. MY BIGGEST PER PEEVE IS THAT EVEN THE DIAMOND CARD DOESNT COVER THE COST OF ONE CHOICE. Not even a 12 diamond choice. Why? If you‚Äôre not going to lower the cost of diamonds per choice at least give enough diamonds to people willing to buy the diamond card with actual money so that they can make 1 whole choice per day in a story that probably averages 10-15 diamond choices if not more. Per chapter. I don‚Äôt mind the wait time for tickets but man the gems are awful.
title: Gems still an issue

review: The title is somewhat misleading as my emphasis is that I feel there should be MORE of these. I feel it is not as consumer friendly as it should be because there are only three LGBT stories, and that's really sad. On top of the issue with different audiences, it is very obvious in most of the stories that none of the choices; even the premium choices really alter events. When you don't care much for a story and so choose exclusively cost-efficient items that push somebody away and then it ends up going directly back to the premium choice, it seems to ruin the point. Some stories like Obsidian are more subtle in their lack of alterations, because it does alter the short-term, but the choices then proceed to be as if they were premium, and I feel like it ruins the whole point. I feel it would be nice to add more LGBT friendly stories, maybe making an effort to work on one all the time, and different alterations. I think it would be great if when you choose to push someone away, a new love interest pops up.
title: Consumer Friendly & Interactive

review: I really enjoyed the stories that have been created so far. Although, 17 Gems for a ‚Äúspecial‚Äù choice seem to be somewhat too much for a single choice. I would be fine with around 11-14 per special choice one reason that 17 gems is so expensive is that when the math is checked 17 multiplied by just 6 choices means you already used more than üíØ 100 gems by then which seems slightly high. at least with 11 gems or 12 you could make at least 8 choices per 100 gems spent. However I love the idea of adding special gem reward choices for certain moments if chosen correctly. When comparing the discrepancy between a unique choice (gems) and number of gems potentially you could get from reading a chapter. I would assume it is probably at BEST like 17 used to 4 gained if you choose a gem choice. I also like the amount of time between passes/tickets it seems quite reasonable to me at least. In addition, the daily video for a free ticket is a nice little bonus.
title: Great and enjoyable but special choices are expensive

review: This game is really great! It‚Äôs incredibly addicting as well as fun. The one problem I have is that the choices are SO costly. Each ‚Äúspecial‚Äù or most ‚Äúdesirable‚Äù choice is around 17 diamonds, and after a couple chapters, you ultimately end up with like 5 left. Once you first start, you get 5 tickets, and then after that, it decreases to a maximum of 2 tickets. It takes over an hour for 1 ticket. Of course, if you had an unlimited amount of diamonds and tickets, the game would be boring, but in this case, the choices should cost less and the tickets should be more. I‚Äôm glad there‚Äôs the ability to get diamonds from ads, but that takes a while to even build up enough to even play one chapter so you can pick a specific choice. You are able to earn coins, but I‚Äôm not sure the importance of them. I‚Äôd rather the coins be able to buy tickets and diamonds, rather than having to actually pay real money with for them. Overall, the game is interesting and captivating; it‚Äôs just hard to play the way you want with how much they give you and how much they require.

review:
*

Don‚Äôt get it. The stories usually hold my attention. However, the tickets and diamonds cost to MUCH. There should be a maximum number of diamonds and tickets the writer can incorporate into their stories. There should also be checks on advertising since they count towards a maximum the reader can use to earn daily. They need to be specific about the number of diamonds that can be earned‚Ä¶ daily. There has been some improvements since I‚Äôve started reading. Today during my reading I watched at least 5 advertisements and received no diamonds. I had to close the app and re-open it. I didn‚Äôt bother to write for support because I have written on this same issue so many other days. I‚Äôm wondering if this is an intentional plot to force the reader to spend more money. Additionally, when I use all Caucasian characters the cost to read is less than when I use characters that are of a darker complexion.

review:
Either spend tons of money or try reading a ‚Äústory‚Äù over the course of a year, because that‚Äôs how long it‚Äôs going to take you without spending anything. I figured I had low interest and a lot of patience, but this app truly makes no effort to give you any sort of good experience unless you‚Äôre forking over money. The diamonds system is ridiculously rigged- you get 2 diamonds per ad watch, then after 4-5 ad watches (8-10 diamonds) you‚Äôre locked out of watching another ad for 7, then 12, then 24 hours. The ‚Äúcheap‚Äù choice is 12 diamonds, and the ‚Äúgood‚Äù choice is 17, meaning you can‚Äôt even earn enough on ad watches to advance a story. Even if you take every single opportunity to earn additional diamonds, you‚Äôre still stuck painstakingly attempting to advance a story for weeks on end. 

The one story that seemed even remotely interesting turned out to be completely mediocre. This app is made for 16 year olds with their parents‚Äô credit cards linked to their apple accounts who got tired of reading fanfiction they couldn‚Äôt insert themselves into enough on the internet.

review: I‚Äôve been reading these interactive story apps for YEARS. But I‚Äôve just recently downloaded this particular app. The first one I‚Äôve downloaded was called ‚ÄòEpisode‚Äô and I loved it. Then I got into the app ‚ÄòChoices‚Äô and loved it as well. Recently, I decided to explore other interactive apps and downloaded many Japanese apps but they all looked weird and just were weird stories in general and maybe about a week ago I came across this app and read the reviews and even though many of the reviews didn‚Äôt speak very highly of the app I still decided to give it a shot and THANK GOODNESS I DID! The first few books I read AND finished I LOOOVEEDD. They were ‚ÄúCalendar Girl‚Äù , ‚ÄúTwice the Growl‚Äù , ‚ÄúInject Me Sweetly‚Äù and I‚Äôm currently on ‚ÄúThe Rake and the Recluse‚Äù they are by far the the most erotic and steamy interactive books I‚Äôve read from an app. And you actually get the legitimate emotions to different characters as if they‚Äôre real. It‚Äôs amazing. I‚Äôd give this app an 8 out of 5 stars if I could!!
title: I LOVE IT!!

review:
i agree with a previous review i saw on here, and i found the response from the developer to be a little rude. responding ‚Äúpity you dont enjoy the game‚Äù is invalidating and the fact you gave her an option to buy a package just solidified their accusation of a money grab game. i fully agree that the cost of diamonds is too high. i have downloaded this game twice now in the hopes that maybe i can figure out how to just PLAY the game instead of spending 2.99 on a 50 pack of diamonds to use them all up on two rounds of picking  game choices. No game on my phone should i have to pay a monthly subscription to a fake story simulator üíÄand the people that do are most likely 10 yr olds with their moms card attached to the app store.

review: There tons of other games exactly like this one, but this one update‚Äôs chapters every week and tell you what stories get updated when. They add more books every week keeping it fresh. The pass to read take 30 minutes to refresh one which is significantly better than the other apps that take 1-2 hours for 1 pass. The down side is some choices and outfits cost diamonds but the creators are doing a great job in giving the diamonds at the end of the chapter, other similar apps won‚Äôt do that or if they do it‚Äôs 1 or 2 diamonds unless you spend real money.A lot of the books are from real published authors so that has definitely expanded my book library because I love the stories so much I want to buy the actual book. If you love writing stories yourself you can post your own story on the app for other people to read as well. All in all the app is great the book choices range over multiple genres and the graphics are amazing.
title: Best game!

review:
This could be a good app and I really enjoyed the first couple chapters of the story line I chose. Much better then those shown on ads. However, I then noticed how costly this game is. While reading the stories you have to pay in ‚Äúdiamonds‚Äù in order to make the ‚Äúgood‚Äù choices at important moments in the story. The choice you want to make. For example; you are reading a secret agent story and have the choice to ‚Äúcapture the villain‚Äù or ‚Äúfreeze up and let the villain get away‚Äù. Capturing the villain costs 17 diamonds and letting them get away is free. 

They give you enough free diamonds when you sign up to make one choice you have to pay diamonds for then you have to start shelling out the cash. A standard choice costs about 17 diamonds an outfit choice maybe 8 diamonds (outfits impact storyline). It costs $1.99 for 20 diamonds. So you are getting about one choice or two outfit choices for two bucks. There are 4-6 choices that cost diamonds in every chapter and my story is 27 chapters. I think you can do the math. This is all about money, not entertainment. I am deleting promptly and suggesting you don‚Äôt waste your time unless you have a lot of extra $$$ you don‚Äôt mind parting with.

review: I gotta start off by saying I love the game. The stories are good for the most part, enough so to keep you waiting for every other chapter, and soon every other book. My only problem would have to be how expensive the choices are. I don‚Äôt mind waiting an hour or so for a couple of keys, but 15-25 diamonds per choice is a bit much when you‚Äôre cheap and you only get 2 diamonds per chapter, assuming you want to watch an ad for it. Hate to whine but it seems a little overboard if you‚Äôre asking me. Though other than all else, the stories are great and helpful for the imagination sometimes. Keeps a creative spark going, cheers to the person who thought up of them. Then again, I‚Äôve only come across maybe three or four of the stories and I haven‚Äôt finished a single one yet, so don‚Äôt take my word. Play for yourself, each person does their own thing. But for the most part, they aren‚Äôt half bad aside from a couple here and there. Incredibly short review, but I didn‚Äôt have much to point out other than those few things.
title: Some cheap woman..with no creativity.
