title: App is good, needs some fixes

review:
I‚Äôve been a Chapters player for over 7 months now. I‚Äôve tried to be lenient with the constant glitching and the greediness of how many gems it takes to finish one story. I‚Äôve also had several issues that I‚Äôve contacted customer support for, and it would take over a month to hear back, only to be given a generic reply that didn‚Äôt even help my issue. 

But today is my tipping point. The creators of this app have caved to a small group. And have removed 3 stories, and changed most of the covers of their stories. The beautiful covers are now hideous and it looks like they didn‚Äôt even try with them. 4 stories now have the exact same models from stock photos, that don‚Äôt even go with the stories! The only plus to this change, is the diversity they‚Äôve added. I‚Äôm ok with that. But changing some covers just got the sake of changing them, i.e. The Bastard Billionaire and The Practice Proposal. There was nothing wrong with those covers! Now they are awful. I know I‚Äôve seen many other upset users as well (on IG, FB, and the app). I just hope Chapters is taking this all into consideration.

review:
i like the idea of these storyline based games, and the power each player has over the ending; just by making a few choices now and again. The animation design is beautiful, the characters are just real enough to make you feel connected to them, and each chapter allows an opportunity to form your character‚Äôs personality. 
While I enjoy almost each and every aspect of the game, and I know that there would eventually be a necessity to offer some options for a standard fee (like the diamond purchases to make select decisions), not purchasing diamonds leaves you with often only one choice to make and it‚Äôs usually the boring one that avoids further interaction and character development. 
The game also doesn‚Äôt start you off with diamonds, allowing for little to no experience with the game‚Äôs added choices, leaving me to wonder if it would have even been worth paying for. 
The game is overall great and I enjoy it very much, even outside of the cost that comes with playing it.
title: good game...$$$

review: I know that everyone says this but the diamonds on this app are ridiculous. I‚Äôm fine with watching ads even though it can get annoying sometimes. I was watching ads yesterday and when I watched too many it made me wait 10 hours to get more. I just finally got off of the timer, and I have been watching more to get diamonds. I have only watched at least 10 ads and it is making me wait 7 hours to get more. This shouldn‚Äôt happen there are enough ads in the world that they could have an unlimited amount. I get making us wait a minute in between, and even if we did watch too many then it would make us wait like 5 minutes or something. But when they make us wait for 10 hours that is crazy. It makes it not fun anymore and it makes me want to delete the app, I wish that they would make the choices like 10 or 12 diamonds for the good choice. I know that they aren‚Äôt even going to look at this because they don‚Äôt listen to our complaints, but this is getting out of hand for how much everything cost on this app.

title: Great but...

review: I have no problem spending money on apps I enjoy and while I really enjoy this one the cost is ridiculous. I spent $5 just to use it up before the chapter is even done, and when left with a choice that uses diamonds or not diamonds it‚Äôs obviously the non diamond one isn‚Äôt even really an option. Now if they charged like $10 for the whole book and getting rid of the whole diamond business you can bet I wouldn‚Äôt have an issue paying for that. But unfortunately that isn‚Äôt the case and I just feel like it‚Äôs a missed opportunity. There‚Äôs apps everywhere that require currency and use ads as an alternative source but if you just offered an ad free affordable way to play then your business would be much more booming. I miss the days when you could buy a game and that was just that, everything is just a cash grab these days and it‚Äôs so discouraging. If this ever changes let me know and I‚Äôll be back in a heartbeat but until then it‚Äôs just not worth it.
title: Really fun but really expensive

review: This is a great story app with lots of different styles. Some are definitely not appropriate if you are under 18. You have more opportunities to earn free diamonds than other story apps. I wish they kept the daily login diamonds past the first week.  While you have the opportunity to earn a lot of free diamonds, there are also tons of opportunities to use them up. All of the ‚Äúgood‚Äù choices in a chapter require diamonds, but I have discovered that half the time it doesn‚Äôt really change the story to not choose the better diamond choice. I do like the fact that there are multiple levels of choices to use your diamonds. I HATEA how to get the ending you want it a book you have to use a bunch of diamonds, so save them. I wish you could keep and access your clothing options like you do in Choices so you can use them again. Even when I pick the slacker clothes the other characters act as if you picked the good one. So again, it doesn‚Äôt matter. I‚Äôm definitely hooked though.
title: Great App -Mixed Feeings

review:
The game is fun to play and for me combines two of my favorite things reading and gameplay. However, there are some issues that I have with it. 

1. You need gems for every decision that doesn‚Äôt include rejecting your love interest and this was a huge turn off to me. Especially since you get so few and have to spend so many at a time. I found that caused me to lose a bit of interest. I think if it cost less gems to do things or you earned more easily it would keep game players interest. 

2. The idea of the tickets to go to the next chapter is nice. I just think you should be able to earn them the same way you earn gems. This will also keep players interested and playing more (in my opinion). 

3. The treasure chest of gems is a good idea, but I feel it occurs too often. I just started and it seems majority of the gem I have earned have been put into treasure chest for me to purchase. That caused me to put the game down for awhile even though I had a day pass. Honestly having the day pass is what made me come back to it. Maybe if the chest wasn‚Äôt so constant and people got a chance to actually collect gems more often from things other than just adds it will keep them more intrigued. 

Overall the story lines I have played have been good and it‚Äôs definitely fun to play. Im not sure I would recommend it to anybody just yet as the things I listed above would instantly make people I know stop playing it. Hope this was helpful.

review:
Listen I hate ads. I hate paying for things in apps. This app has made me lose control. 

1) ads
You don‚Äôt have to watch them if you don‚Äôt want to BUT then you lose out on free diamonds and doubled rewards and other rewards. I‚Äôm forcing myself to watch every ad possible to get as many rewards because somehow I find myself low in them. 

2) I have actually bought diamonds, tickets, vip, and diamond pass. It‚Äôs SO WORTH IT. I save so much in rewards while I‚Äôm in the app and the regeneration time is cut down and the max amount to stock up on for tickets is increased. 

3) I haven‚Äôt really played any phone games or used any other entertainment app since I got Chapters. It‚Äôs that interesting. 

4) there‚Äôs 2 sections of this app. There‚Äôs one where you can choose choices as you move through the books and then there‚Äôs the community section. The community section has me dying. But also you don‚Äôt use any diamonds in the community section; you can use tickets to read or watch an ad. There‚Äôs no limit to how many ads you can watch to activate a chapter in the community section. 

In addition to app stuff, I‚Äôm not the best with emotions because of autism. This app helps me see experiences in a variety of perspectives even if it is just fiction. The emotion that comes across is still there. 

Disclaimer: some books have really bad grammar and spelling issues but it‚Äôs still so worth it
title: This app has me melting

review:
Keep in mind that a diamond choice worth 17 costs around $1.36 if you buy the best value diamond pack. There are ways to earn diamonds but there seems to be a cap on how many you can earn.. I think the diamond choices should be lowered to 10 or lower. I've found that using them doesn't alter the story by much, most only give you an extra line or two , so in my opinion they definitely aren't worth spending over a dollar to pick a diamond choice. 
That being said,
I was playing the game choices but they really try to rip you off with their diamond system. I was looking for a similar game and found this. First of all ‚ÄòInject me sweetly‚Äô is the best book I‚Äôve read on any of these types of book choice games! Not thing like a vampire romanceü§§ I‚Äôve read it many times and can‚Äôt wait for you to come out with more!!! I hope you add more soon!! Also I really love the fact that you are able to earn diamonds (unlike Choices). Keep up the great work here, I love it!
title: So much better!

review: Honesty is always the best policy, so with that, I have to say that the diamonds are rather pricy.  BUT otherwise it‚Äôs so clean cut and super worth the money. The stories I have read are sublime and the characters are, (and I can‚Äôt emphasise this enough), perfectly written. I love the diversity in the stories. I have downloaded many interactive story apps and nothing compares to this one. To prove my love for this app, I have to tell you this: I accidentally deleted the app rearranging my other apps and after challenges with my payment info, I couldn‚Äôt download it again until I had more money in my account, and I cried. I downloaded other apps hoping I‚Äôd find something like this app, and I couldn‚Äôt. I finally got some money into my account today and cried tears of joy when I could reinstall it. So yes, if you‚Äôre contemplating downloading this app, I swear on my life it‚Äôs going to be the best thing you‚Äôd do.

review: I love all of the storylines. They all keep me interested and excited for the next chapter. The diamonds, however, make me really angry. They shouldn‚Äôt decide the decisions in the stories. I understand that the app wants to make money off of them because you have to buy them or watch ads if you run out, but they shouldn't be used nearly as frequently as they are. Some of the decisions make extreme changes to the story and it just makes me mad. You don‚Äôt use them to decide what you look like in the beginning of the story, so it shouldn‚Äôt decide anything that you should be choosing in the story. The game is all about choosing your own path, but I can‚Äôt when I have to pick something I didn‚Äôt want because the game is forcing me to watch an ad or pay for them. Also, when you buy diamonds, you only get 20, and most of the decisions you base them on are 14 diamonds or higher. Kind of a rip off if you ask me. Other than the diamonds I like the stories. If it weren‚Äôt for the diamonds I would‚Äôve rated this a 5 star app.

review: I've never been one to use story apps or read romance stories really, but the stories on this app are good at building up suspense and tying in puzzle pieces of the story together. I do like the 2 tickets per 30 minutes system, but the diamond choice system could be more generous, in that 17 diamonds for a single choices seems a bit much. My only actual complaint is the achievement system which I'm logged in with my Facebook account, and some of the achievements aren't being detected, which annoys me since achievements give free diamonds and tickets I think. Overall, it has good stories with a few mediocre ones scattered around. I found this app through a snapchat ad which I don't take pride in, but now I'm glad to have downloaded this app. It has sparked back my interest in reading as a total, even if the stories are on a easy reading level compared the books I usually read.

review: I actually like the story line and the option to decide your responses, however the ‚Äúfree‚Äù options to earn gems and tickets has not worked one time since playing. I am getting an error everytime I select to watch the ad that the video is not available and to try again later. I don‚Äôt mind spending money but the ad option should work to assist with progression. I also think that the pricing of the gem options shouldn‚Äôt be so steep for every time you have to choose one. Maybe like the more serious ones be the 12/17 but some of the others be 3/5 or something else less costly. Ultimately as a consumer we are more likely to want to choose the less expensive options more frequently than the big chunk. Especially when the only option for more gems/tickets is purchasing. Leaves a bad taste in your mouth for wanting to continue. I will most likely end up deleting if my hand is forced with purchases only in order to progress

review: Too many diamond choices. It‚Äôs especially problematic if a choice is a simple courtesy. Like deciding to comfort someone or just say something nice instead of being a completely cold MC. I dropped $30 on diamonds and they were gone by the end of the story. Remind you, I paid the $30 at the near END of the book. So I only had 4 chapters left. This was over a total of 600 diamonds. it didn‚Äôt last the 4 chapters. Never have I ever felt completely fooled and played! review: I love this app so much. I love reading and I love writing on it. I understand copyright pictures and you turning down a story because of that, but it would be very helpful if you told us which picture it was so we wouldn‚Äôt have to delete all of our pictures trying to figure it out. title: Love this app, but I have some suggestions

review: I‚Äôve played on other apps like episode and choices, and the reason why I like this one better is because you can watch ads to earn diamonds and its two diamonds per ad. They should also make an option where you can watch ads instead of paying diamonds on choices and clothes like on ‚ÄúMy love and dating story.‚Äù I also like that you can sign in on google or facebook and save your progress. There is also an option to write a story and most stories I‚Äôve seen so far have been made by members not chapters and I‚Äôm looking forward to making my own. review: This is by far one of the better story games I‚Äôve played and it become so addictive within just the first story. Only downside is having to spend actual money on diamonds since it seems like a diamond choice is almost every other point in just one chapter. Being VIP doesn‚Äôt really make a difference diamond wise which is a real bummer because your paying 9.99 monthly and you don‚Äôt get any extra diamonds that would be worth paying the monthly price. Even with a certain amount off isn‚Äôt always guaranteed. I think I spend more on diamonds to complete the story if it had an option to unlock a book with premium choices or a monthly subscription that allows that at a certain price than spending all this extra money to buy the diamonds would be better. Other than that I love this game.
title: Great but cost of diamonds‚Ä¶

review: Despite loving to play this game, the amount of time and tedious qualifications that it takes to get a measly 2-5 diamonds when you need 17 diamonds to make a choice in one story is outrageous. I spend MORE time trying to earn diamonds than I do playing the actual game. It‚Äôs exhausting and frustrating. I can‚Äôt even enjoy the game due to this. I will be deleting this game, and finding another that doesn‚Äôt make me waste 30 minutes just to gather 5 diamonds to make ONE choice worth 17 diamonds. Despite the game being good and engaging, the problem with the diamonds outweighs the good of their game. The ratio of the income of diamonds compared to the output of diamonds is unfair. Make each choice more like 7-10 diamonds, and I bet you‚Äôll have a lot of more customers. The ‚Äúdaily check in‚Äù and other given diamonds don‚Äôt cut it, either. That only pays for maybe 1/3 of the choices and you‚Äôre left spending 30+ minutes trying to make up the difference to make one choice.

title: Great stories but very expensive.

review:
For one I enjoy this game, It has good story lines. However, I think a few changes can be made. There should be a few stories  that you can play in a male‚Äôs perspective rather than a female‚Äôs. I also think that the game is to expensive and that the rewards offered are not enough. 

In the game, you are given the option of exchanging coins for diamonds. 40 coins is equal to one diamond, which I think is a rip-off. The system can be change by having ten coins equal one diamond, which I think is more fair.  You are also allowed to complete objectives to obtain coins. But, most of those objectives include buying premium outfits or options. These require diamonds, which I usually lack. 

There should also be other ways to obtain free diamonds like watching ads for two diamonds each. I also believe that the cost of selecting certain options during gameplay is too strenuous and expensive. I have to earn a lot of coins and watch a lot of ads just to get up to twelve diamonds to open up one option, I have done it so much that it gets tiresome and I end up not wanting to play. If the cost was dropped to, say, five diamonds versus twelve, I would be playing a lot longer. 

This would benefit you since the longer I play, the more ads I watch. 

Please take my opinion into consideration to make the experience better. Thank you for putting up with my complaining.
title: Too expensive

review: I‚Äôve really tried to get past a lot of the aggravation that comes with this game but I think I‚Äôve reached my limit. If you want people to pay and be consistent readers you need to reply when there‚Äôs a problem. I‚Äôve messaged about at least 3 offers never being rewarded despite meeting the required criteria and still haven‚Äôt received one response. Also the free gems ads went from being 4-8 gems each to literally 1! Then you limit how many free ads someone can complete per 24hrs!? I became a vip member and still feel like I‚Äôm being ripped off completely. Also note when they say they‚Äôre gonna charge your card they charge more than the advertised amount. For example if the package you buy is 4.99 it‚Äôll actually be almost $8 charged to your card. Chapters please seriously revamp a lot of these issues. Sooo many of your readers have complained constantly about the same thing and yet here we still are with another unsatisfied customer.

review: Most stories are enjoyable and I like the app about as much as I like Some of my other choice-based story apps. I only have 2 problems with the app. 1) as someone already said, things are more expensive in this app in regards to the premium choices and chapter diamond payoffs are just okay. 2) diamonds. So as I said before, premium choices cost more diamonds than in other apps. However, the app is not consistent in how you can earn diamonds. You can always buy, but I try to not too that too often. At one point you got a chance to earn 5 diamonds a day. Then, recently, it changed to you could earn as many diamonds as you were willing to sit through ads. I personally like the last option because I can just run the ads on my phone through the work day so I can have enough to get through a couple of chapters when I‚Äôm home. I hope they keep that option and maybe consider 2 diamonds if the ad is longer.
userName: mommy needs a glass of wine
title: Good stories

review:
I enjoy reading some of the stories. Yes, the writing needs some work and some of the stories are extremely cliche, but they can be fun to read.

One issue is that it gets really annoying with the gems, as to do any action it costs a lot. In the earlier stories made, if you chose a certain option you could gain gems yet that stopped for some reason. And to get free gems, you can watch one video and get one, complete a chapter of a book you haven't read (so you only get a gem if it's the first time you read it), once you finish a book you'll get some, and there's the tasks needed to be completed as well (only on first completion of book) 

Although it seems like there's a lot of ways to earn gems, it's actually difficult to do so, since the prices for outfits and actions in the book are expensive. I think if there were more ways to earn gems (with the new added feature, with earning cards for certain tasks completed in a book), you could make it so when you get a card you earn gems or making it so in the new stories, if you choose a certain option you're able to get gems too.

Besides the gems, I like the app and I just think there needs to be improvements to either make it possible to earn more gems or to make it cheaper to buy certain items or choices.
title: Fun, but gems are an issue

review: This is one of my more favorite interactive stories apps. Unfortunately, I still have multiple issues with it. For one, you wait hours upon hours to only receive 2 tickets, and half the time the episodes only last maybe 5 or 6 minutes even when they claim to last 12. Also, I already know tons of people have made comments about diamonds or gems. I understand there are multiple ways to earn them, but it takes forever to accumulate enough and actually be able to use them and even then you have to kind of save them until the end to get the result you want which makes zero sense. If you make half of the story diamond options, give us more diamonds at a time or more ways to earn them. I‚Äôve dealt with the app closing out on me as well when I go to collect my diamonds at the end of the episode and I never receive them. This makes it that much more frustrating. I love that there is such a wide selection of stories, but this app could definitely be better.

A lot of people have been saying in their reviews that this is one of the best story apps out there, but to me it‚Äôs by far the worst. As an avid player of Choices and a writer, this game is boring and terribly written. I feel as if I‚Äôm reading a fan fiction written by someone who‚Äôs never left their house. 
For example, I read a story titled Calendar Girl (or something like that) and in the first two chapters all the MC did was talk about sex. The drama was unrealistic, and I get that it has to be slightly exaggerated to make it interesting, but it moves too fast. In the second chapter I had already ditched my family, and was living with a random guy. And the guy was supposed to be hot and sexy, but he just came off like a total creep. 
And yeah, you only have to wait half an hour for a ticket, but what‚Äôs the point of getting tickets fast when what you‚Äôre using them for isn‚Äôt worth it? And the diamond choices are awful - you barely skim the surface if you don‚Äôt want to pay. 
All in all, this game is horrible, and there is also zero diversity??
Don‚Äôt get this app, and whatever you do, do NOT spend money on it. It isn‚Äôt worth it.
title: Terrible

title: It is pretty good

review: This app has the potential to be really good, but it‚Äôs spoiled by the ridiculous amount of diamond choices per chapter. That being said, this is the only app that gives tons of opportunities to earn diamonds (reading new chapters and watching 5 ads a day for 5 diamonds). The love interests often come off as creepy and aggressive, and the writing is very unpolished. A lot of typos and errors, and I‚Äôve even noticed that the music doesn‚Äôt match up with the scenes in the books. In ‚ÄòPrince With Benefits‚Äô, during romantic moments, tense and creepy music often plays even though it‚Äôs obvious that isn‚Äôt the tone they are trying to set. Compared to this app, Choices, and Episode, Choices is still the superior app. With the writing and amount of diamond choices littering Chapters, and the many people saying they didn‚Äôt even receive their diamonds that they purchased, I won‚Äôt be wasting my money on this one. It‚Äôs still pretty fun to pass the time though, so it gets 3 stars from me so far.

The next time I renew is July first and it‚Äôs possible I won‚Äôt. I have slowly been getting rid of the expensive reading apps and games. review: I love this app. There‚Äôs a lot of different stories to choose from, and the visual is great. However, there is a huge downside- I can‚Äôt actually choose the choices I want to choose. The diamonds are ridiculous, and I know I speak for a lot of people when I say that you would have a lot more people downloading this app if that were to change. Also, if you have more people downloading the app, you will clearly have a steady income. Another thing I would add is that there aren‚Äôt a lot of choices for a lesbian, like myself. The stories containing realistic lgbtqia+ relationships are very limited. I feel like it wouldn‚Äôt be that hard to simply put an lgbtqia+ option at the beginning of the heterosexual stories. A gender option really isn‚Äôt very difficult. Overall, I‚Äôm conflicted, and may be deleting this app. If I could do two and a half stars, I would.

review:
I really do enjoy this app and the stories on it. This is the first story app I have downloaded, so I really have no other to compare it to. One of my favorite things about the app is the TapTales‚Äô I understand the idea of spending diamonds for certain outfits and responses, however, I feel that the number requires should be lowered. Another issue I have is, although there are several ways to earn diamonds, there are no ways for you to receive tickets to continue the chapters of a story you are trying to read. It seems like the only real way is through redemption codes from Instagram(which are not given daily, more like twice a week). This is frustrating when you are in the middle of a story and have no more tickets to finish it. 
    My suggestion is to lower the number of diamonds needed for responses and add more ways (even if it‚Äôs another tab to watch more ads) to earn tickets. Other than that this is a very entertaining app.
title: Great App, but...

review:
Chapters is a fun place to read along as a confident lead to take a break from the stress of everyday lives. I‚Äôve  had the app for over a year and love the growth it‚Äôs gone through over time. However, there are a few things I would like to touch on.

Firstly, customization options are too limited and not consistently attractive or up to date with modern fashion. Some hairstyles do not match up with the faces of the Characters, and can turn people off from reading the rest of the book. I can‚Äôt tell you how many times I‚Äôve stopped reading a book because MC looked too constipated for my liking and her love interest was just as bad. I highly recommend a character closet (where you can change the appearance of your character whenever you want‚Äîhair, clothes, makeup, eye color, etc.) or a broader (and more consistent) range of options to choose from.

Secondly, there are responses that should not cost gems in certain stories. Sometimes it does matter if you ‚Äúwalk away‚Äù or ‚Äútake a step closer.‚Äù But there are some times where spending 15 gems just goes to waste because no matter what you say, the outcome is the same.

In conclusion, while Chapters is a fun getaway with LGBT rep, there are some things I believe should be tweaked.

Thank you for reading this! I hope this was helpful to both the Chapters team and future Chapters consumers!
title: Love-Hate Relationship

review:
I really like games close to this, the ones where you get to choose your characters looks and your choices effect the outcome of the story. I have played other mobile games like this that are more fun because you get fully customize your character and all choices are free. 
I knew going into this that this game is different but the fact that choices are locked by diamonds and you don't really get to choose how the story goes. The outcome is already planned out by "premium choices". The top choice costs a lot of diamonds while second choice is a premium choice but the ideal choice. While the last choice, the free choice, is just not a choice you want to choose because they make it a bad choice. They want you to spend diamonds so you have buy more diamonds for more premium options.
You don't even get to fully customize your character. 
It's not a great game and I wanted to like it but with technically paid choices and lame character customization I just couldn't find how people enjoy it.

review:
I had been playing and had 200 gems and 13 tickets when my app stopped working. I couldn‚Äôt find any other solution but to delete and reinstall.  I did and LOST EVERYTHING!  Gems, tickets, half-read stories... EVERYTHING!  Now, I can‚Äôt even get the ‚Äúfreebies‚Äù because it registers that I had already gotten them!  I have complained to the app people and will give reasonable time to resolve, but there is no resolution, I‚Äôm out.

That said, it certainly seemed that after I bought gems, the more choices there were that required them to continue the story as the free choices were either ridiculous or unacceptable to continue the story in a reasonable way.  Also, someone needs to re-think the clothing choices for the events happening in the stories. Example:  I had a character going towards a brunch date and the clothing choices were nightclub wear, a revealing dress that was appropriate for an evening date or a frumpy sweatshirt and jeans! Really?!?  

It fun to be able to guide the stories but it‚Äôs also super-frustrating!
title: Frustrated!

review:
If you want a short version, most of these stories are real ebooks you can buy instead of throwing money at a game to have the illusion of a choice (whatever you pick always leads to the same thing). For example one story has you decide whether or not you want to take your ex back. Whether you say yes or no, your character still eventually goes ‚Äúwell I probably should get back together with him‚Äù. 
Longer version? It‚Äôs really frustrating how any good option requires gems. It feels almost impossible to get enough to pick a good option. You get one gem for each chapter but there‚Äôs only two tickets to play with. I started with five so I figured maybe it just took a while but no, it stops at two. You could pay for more gems and tickets but after watching other people play the same stories using only gems I realized the outcome is always the same. Even in the comments people complained about spending money for the choices they wanted but then it doesn‚Äôt actually happen.
title: Save the time/money

Well the response from the company was very disrespectful and disregarding because the first sentence they reply with is "Pity if the game did not live up to your expectations‚Äù that‚Äôs not very professional and sounds like someone struggles taking constructive criticism when a company should expect comments and opinions. review: I have been reading stories in the app since the beginning until about 2 weeks ago when they changed the ability to earn enough diamonds to make ACTUAL choices. I have never had to watch 4 ads JUST to start a chapter nor have I read a chapter made many diamond choices and at the end of the chapter instead of what I use to have (get 2 free diamonds with zero add or 4 diamonds for 1 ad watch) now I can‚Äôt earn any diamonds without watching 2-3 adds after EACH chapter. It takes the joy out of reading a halfway decent story. I have spent so much money on extras and supported the app and authors and the thanks we get is to take away the one thing we enjoy and that is to enjoy a good story. I did not come to this decision lightly but my days of reading Chapters stories are done. I will no longer recommend this app to anyone. It is no longer worth it. How can you read a book and then give an honest review of it when there are more ads and less book/choice interaction. It is no longer any fun.

review:

 In order to use any. Of the nice choices you have to use ‚Äúdiamonds‚Äù which you buy with your own real money. I was fine spending money on the $5 option for a few diamonds to be able to use them here and there, but they didn‚Äôt even last more than 1 chapter. I ended up spending $10 on these ‚Äúdiamonds‚Äù and it‚Äôs just stupid in my opinion that you cannot even enjoy the app unless you are using them. I understand they want to make money but there should be more of a balance for it (to have it even be enticing to buy a few). review: I love this app. I have had it for a while now. There‚Äôs all different types of story‚Äôs ranging from romance, horror, and comedy. There is a way to get diamonds by watching ads, but it runs out and I can‚Äôt get anymore for the whole rest of the day. Now I know why they set it up like this, but it‚Äôs kinda absurd that almost every choice is 17 diamonds. And like some people we‚Äôre broke and can‚Äôt afford to by diamonds like they want us to. So I think one of the only things that should be changed is putting in another easy way for us broke people to get diamonds so we keep playing the app. But other than that it‚Äôs a great app. I would definitely recommend

Bubbles and videos aren‚Äôt even good enough. It is ridiculous that we have a certain number of videos we can watch and bubbles we can receive. This makes me so mad that i could delete the app but the stories draw me in. Probably once i‚Äôm done with this story i‚Äôm on i‚Äôm going to delete the app. There should be no limit to the bubbles or videos. review: Everything costs diamonds! Not 5 or 10 diamonds but 17. For $2.99 you get 20 diamonds and for $4.99 you get 60, therefore any time you want to do something more interesting you have to spend at least $2.99. It will probably cost you $60-$80 to do a whole story, I‚Äôm not sure because i deleted this app in the middle of a story because i don‚Äôt want to spend anymore money. Even if you spend the diamonds to enhance the story it doesn‚Äôt mean your get that enhancement. For example: in the story I was reading they kept referring to the girls past and something her father did. So finally I spent the 17 diamonds to find what happened and they just said she woke up in the middle of the night and called out to him and heard a bang. That‚Äôs it. I‚Äôm not sure if that bang was him taking his own life or someone else doing it or maybe he was hanging a picture, I have no idea. They need to come up with a way for people to earn more diamonds, 2 at the end of every chapter isn‚Äôt nearly enough and they need to lower the cost of everything. Why must everything cost 17 diamonds!!!
title: WAY TOO EXPENSIVE

review: Chapters is a great app with a diverse range of stories. Most of them provide customizable characters, with appearance and pronouns. Though I have only read a few stories so far, I can definitely say this is one of the best apps for reading and writing stories compared to others. Though the diamond system is a bit irritating, there is the ability to earn diamonds by making offers and what so ever. The only other way to ‚Äúearn‚Äù them is by buying VIP or buying them separately in large quantities. Another thing I have to say is that there are few LGBTQ+ stories, though that was only when I went to that category so there could possibly be more. If you enjoy reading stories with romance, sci-fi, paranormal, BDSM, forbidden love, LGBTQ+, etc. Then you need to download this app!!!
title: I Definitely recommend

review: The story line of the one book I completed was very riveting. But every good ‚Äúchoice‚Äù cost a lot of real money so you can‚Äôt really interact with the story unless you go broke doing so. You‚Äôre better off just reading a real book instead. It‚Äôs so frustrating to have to pay for EVERY choice you want to make. It really takes the fun out of the game and you end up more frustrated than relaxed when the whole point of a game is to HAVE FUN. I‚Äôve deleted this app because it‚Äôs not worth paying hundreds of dollars (that‚Äôs what it amounts to if you pay to have choices) in order to read an interactive story. I wish there was an interactive story app where players could earn at least 5 gems per add they watch as well as more opportunities to watch adds for gems(story choices). On this app, you can only get one gem per ad and there is only one ad after each chapter. The alternative is to end up spending hundreds of real U.S. dollars on gems. Total bummer because it‚Äôd be ridiculous for anyone to spend that amount of money on a game. Not a good app.

review:
I‚Äôm honestly surprised that there isn‚Äôt more negative reviews, this game robs its players any chance it gets (which is multiple times every chapter) My word of advice would be to not pay for paid choices as forwards words because you‚Äôll end up getting the same result with the free one. Why are paid word choices in the game if it doesn‚Äôt matter anyway? You‚Äôre just robbing your players. 
 And I also wouldn‚Äôt recommend buying outfits because you won‚Äôt be able to wear them again, like I previously stated, why even implement paid options that won‚Äôt matter anyways. And also most of the stories look like they‚Äôve been written by a middle schooler, there is no sort of dynamic qualities about the characters and they all have the same plot: Arrogant, d*uchebag rich guy is pursued by a insecure, naive female. Can we get a story with a strong, level headed female? Why is every protagonist a woman who doesn‚Äôt know what she wants and acts thirsty for a guy who is rude and out of her league? 
I like the game it‚Äôs just very annoying how this company robs and deceives their player base.
title: Pure Robbery

review:
At first glance, this app is fun. On the first day, you get enough introductory rewards that you can get through 1/2 of 3/4 of a story without spending real money. But toward the end of that first story, you have to spend $5-20 to make the ‚ÄúVIP‚Äù selections. And that‚Äôs where it gets RIDICULOUS. Your ‚Äúchoices‚Äù are literally ‚Äúhave a steamy sex scene‚Äù or ‚Äúrelease a giant fart.‚Äù or ‚Äúwear a sexy dress that your love interest will love‚Äù or ‚Äúwear an ugly dress from the back of your closet.‚Äù There‚Äôs no middle ground that saves your character‚Äôs dignity and doesn‚Äôt totally kill the sexy aesthetic of the story. 
If you want to play through an entire story without the frumpy outfits or the embarrassing story choices, it will cost you about $100 per story. And that‚Äôs even with the VIP pass that makes the sexy or even acceptable choices ‚Äúless expensive.‚Äù I got through two stories before uninstalling this stupid cash grab. You can find better erotica for free online.
title: It‚Äôs not ‚Äúfun‚Äù unless you spend A LOT of money

review:
First I will say this is not a fake review. I have downloaded multiple interactive apps and this by far is the best one. The app has preset books that are available to read and they usually have weekly drops. Such a wide selection of books and categories to chose from. I will say the pricing for premium selections is ridiculous. If you don‚Äôt spend a lot of money depending it could effect the story. 

Now for the best part of the app. It has community stories and those are free to read and cost nothing. There are really talented authors who publish on here. You can even be a publisher and get paid to write. Omg üòÉ now some of the community stories will have diamond choices but it is usually if an author entered the book for a contest.  But most of those are free. Don‚Äôt second guess yourself download the app. Happy Reading!!.

title: Bring it back

review:
I enjoy the app, but wish there were more ways to earn diamonds within the chapters besides cash. Like when a premium choice pops up, you could watch some ads to make the choice you want. While there‚Äôs a free option, they‚Äôre always frustrating and the opposite of what I‚Äôd actually choose.

Yeah, you can earn diamonds outside the chapters themselves, but there‚Äôs a very short limit. Once you‚Äôve completed a task, that‚Äôs it. No more options. I can maybe earn enough diamonds to make one good choice a story. Not a chapter, a story. And I always regret not saving it when an even more important seeming decision comes up. Not to mention, the ads often won‚Äôt load and then they‚Äôre no longer an option.

The stories themselves I enjoy. I like the interaction of it, you‚Äôll probably get the ending you hope, just wish it were more satisfying.

review: This is one of my favorite story apps I've ever used. I've used pretty much all of them and I've spent money on all of them but I always seem to delete them after a while and sometimes re download them if I'm bored. But this story app is my favorite so far. I love the stories it has and the special effects and characters are really great. I love that it has different genres and it even has stories that represent the gay/ lesbian crowd. The story lines are awesome and some are even realistic to me. I love starting a new book and just escaping into another character other then me. I'm a big bookworm and this is very relaxing to me. My only thing is I wish they would put newer books and chapters out faster. I have no problem spending money on this app because I know it's going to be worth it in the end.
title: Best Story App I've ever used

review:
With the new update they have made the game practically unplayable. Not only have the stories gotten worse and less interesting, but now you‚Äôre harassed with ads for everything you do. It makes for a very poor reading experience. 

They are giving you less to enjoy with each update instead of more. I used to enjoy using this app, but now it feels like a headache. The fact that you now only get two diamonds after reading a whole chapter and watching three ads, at the least, when you can get the same two diamonds for just watching one ad (that might have 5 ten second videos you have to watch unfortunately) seems silly and in bad taste to me. 

What was once an enjoyable escape has become irritating and tiresome. I used to recommend this game to people, but now I‚Äôm hoping there is another service that will offer what you once did. This new update is quite bad, I‚Äôve been playing for years and it‚Äôs only getting worse. At least the stories before were more enjoyable. It made the few ads less annoying.

But not anymore. Even the people who pay for VIP are dealing with unnecessary crap for the price they are paying. If you want to watch a lot of ads and read very little, then maybe this will be fine for you. I spend more time watching ads as I do reading these average stories.
title: Not enjoyable reading app, far too many ads

2) When picking a character at the start of a book, why can‚Äôt we have hairstyles, clothing or facial features that were used in other stories on here? I know there‚Äôs probably different designers that have worked on this app over time, so it‚Äôs hard to be consistent, but why not just allow us to have all of them to pick from? I‚Äôve noticed so many people complaining on here about not liking some of the newer graphics and refusing to read the story because of it. title: Chapters

review:
I love this game. The writers do a great job at hooking you in. I especially love that I can read for hours without running out of tickets. They also have an option of watching commercials to get more diamonds for the game which makes it easier to get the premium selections. 

The downside of the game is that, there is quite a bit of misspellings in the stories such as ‚Äúmade for mad and want for won‚Äôt‚Äù. Along with forgetting words altogether. That kind of confused and irritated me because I thought these were stories from young writers that won awards or were nominated and featured for their writing. Yet they don‚Äôt proofread or have anyone that will proofread for them to catch these errors. 

Overall great job on these and maybe just do a little bit of research on some situations unless they‚Äôre just going for a more comical approach.
title: Some good storylines but they should work on spelling.

review: This app is actually extremely enjoyable, I just wish you guys would makes the prices to make choices more reasonable so we don‚Äôt have to choose choices we don‚Äôt want to make (or that make the story distasteful) and to actually give us a way to earn diamonds without buying them (at least reward us with a diamond after every chapter and then have the premium choices range from 7‚Äì15 diamonds). It would make the experience way better because it‚Äôs honestly aggravating to be limited to negative choices, especially if you JUST spent 17 on a choice and you have to make another and there‚Äôs no frequent way to earn diamonds other than buying them. You have to watch an ad just to make 2 choices after purchasing diamonds. Speaking for many others, it‚Äôs frustrating when you can make 3+ premium choices per chapter.

title: Agreed!

review:
I love the choose your adventure stories and apps, so when I heard this one was coming onto the Apple market I was excited! I like that you earn diamonds by playing, and have the opportunity to earn diamonds by watching a video every now and then, but many of the choices still cost a lot of diamonds. I can appreciate that most of the diamond choices don‚Äôt really effect the story, but that also makes me feel like that is pointless to have. I also notice a ton of spelling errors and immature language in some of the stories. I‚Äôm not sure if the writers speak English as their first language or not? 

In any case, this is a fun app. It will be even better as they continue to grow their story base. I would still say the choices app is my favorite of this genre though. I‚Äôm willing to pay the money for better content in that sense.
title: Good but could be great

review: So some of the stories are halfway decent. BUT, like every other choice you‚Äôre having to spend copious amounts of diamonds to have the storyline go how you want it to in order be more interesting, and that‚Äôs where the app developers get you. You‚Äôre either spending a lot of money to get more diamonds for the ‚Äúpremium‚Äù choice, or spending a huge amount of time watching ads/clicking through sponsored webpages to get more without spending money, which is incredibly tedious. I‚Äôd say you‚Äôre better off spending the money on Danielle Steel novels or whatever other romance novels that are out there, the stories go the direction that you‚Äôre looking for them to go in and you‚Äôre not spending an outrageous amount of time and money for so little reward.

title: ~The Absolute Best!~

review: The stories are numerous and varied.  Ranging from rom-coms laced with F-bombs to enchanting fantasies, to realistic drama and pregnancy stories.  Most of them end with an overdue proposal of marriage and the choices can be really difficult to make.  The rewards are a bit unbalanced though, heavy on the rewards that enable you to start stories, but short on the rewards needed for premium choices.  Another shortcoming is heterosexual stories from the man‚Äôs point of view.  I am always playing from the woman‚Äôs perspective and all the stories from a man‚Äôs perspective are homosexual stories or are alternative views in the women‚Äôs stories that are hidden behind the VIP membership.  I would like to see more heterosexual stories from the man‚Äôs perspective and greater opportunities to earn premium choices or exchange rewards that I have too many of for rewards that I have too few of.

review:
I enjoyed this app at first.  Yes the diamond aspect was annoying.  You need to pay for most good choices, and without them it severely limits stories, but there were a few stories I enjoyed enough to do anyway.

However, there are less and less compelling stories, and the series I enjoy are being stretched into less and less interesting sequels that are more filler than meaningful plot.  

Add in that there is less and less personalization in the newer stories and the quality is truly going downhill.  The prime example is the winter stories for popular series.  Some of which, while they let you import your things from the series don‚Äôt import your character, and then with limited face and hair options may cause you to have a character that looks nothing like your character in the series.  That‚Äôs just lazy, but largely indicative of the general decline of quality in this app.  There needs to be improvement or it will no longer be worth it.
title: Getting worse and worse

review: I do love this app, I only got it a few days ago and have completed more than enough stories. The only problem I have is the fact that certain choices cost gems. I think it would be much better if whole stories cost gems instead, than you could complete different stories to save enough gems to unlock other stories. It is annoying to have saved up enough gems and then a choice comes and you get to use those gems, then another choice comes, and you regret using them. I do know this is your app, you do what you want with it and you don‚Äôt have to listen to  reviews all the time, but I really think his would be a great change to the app, make it a little different than others in a good way, because I feel like a lot of apps like these have choices that cost gems, and I always get annoyed with these.
title: Love it

review: I‚Äôve found this game to be amazing!! Full of choices, and opportunities to make an impact on the characters choice and decisions meaning it‚Äôs highly interactive! However, the situation with the gems having to buy them and having no way to earn them is quite frustrating and it‚Äôs very important choices too that change the way the story plays out. A lot of the choices in a story and by a lot I mean 90% of the choices you make are done using gems which at the start you are only given 4 gems and these choices are asking for 14-20. With other apps that share the same features and have the same purpose, you are able to earn, are rewarded, or even have the opportunity to gain gems free of charge. It makes this game so much more limiting. It would be amazing, if it offered alternative ways to earn gems and tickets. As other apps do. Other than that, what an amazing app!!

review:
It‚Äôs been almost 24 hours and not a single ticket has been added to my account for me to read a chapter. Each option cost about 15-17 diamonds and each chapter has multiple scenes that have you pick between 2 good answers both requiring diamonds and a bad choice which cost no diamonds. After you read a chapter in order to get your 2 diamonds it make you watch an ad. Since you get 2 diamonds per chapter each option should only cost 1-2 diamonds. 
It‚Äôs a good read and entertaining but frustrating not being able to read the story the way you want without purchasing outrageously expensive diamonds. 
Trying to submit this it says every nickname is taken. Must be it doesn‚Äôt wAnt a 2 star rating!
title: 2 stars! Won‚Äôt let me submit with less than 5

review: I had been enjoying Chapters for over a year, but I finally deleted it when I realized that it can easily cost $25+ to play a story enjoyably. That‚Äôs just too much. I understand and respect their need to earn money, but the amount of diamonds needed as well as the number of choices involving diamonds skyrocketed within the last year. Also, they re-released a story only to delete the original (it wasn‚Äôt changed much‚Äîmostly cosmetic changes as well as a slight change to the ending to set up for a sequel‚Äîbut it was mostly identical story wise). So, everybody who poured diamonds into the original lost their purchase, forcing customers to replay and repurchase a recycled story. After I finished my last story, I deleted the app. Devs: I understand paying around $10 to reasonably explore a Chapters story, but what you‚Äôre trying to get people to pay to enjoy premium choices is just greedy now.
title: Great app, but they got greedy

review: I LOVE the stories on this app. I read a lot. I have 3 of these apps and my kindle and read every change I get. BUT I HATE the prices. I pay 9.99 a month on one app and have unlimited kindle. I am ok paying to read if I love it. BUT. 1.99 per 5 chapters is BS. Straight up. I paid it once. Almost twice. Then I decided I refuse to pay such unrealistic prices. I may put this app on pause for a while or check in every week or so. I really really hope you guys can come to a solution for avid readers. I do hate paying diamonds for choices but I get that more than the insane chapters prices. That‚Äôs a choice I can make and move in. But I want to read a book from front to back. Not wait two hours to read more chapters. Seems like you could make more money letting us read and chose more diamond items. Idk. But app wise I would rate a 2. Story wise your a 10 in my book. You have some amazing amazing writers.
title: Love love the stories.

review:
I‚Äôve been playing Chapters for years now, it‚Äôs a nice way to spend time relaxing. I‚Äôve never complained about ads, diamonds, the lack of queer representation, or the way body types conform and support beauty standards in men and women. But, this is something that I just can‚Äôt get over.

Recently, they have been some absolutely disgusting and triggering ads. Not even the mature kind, but I‚Äôm talking body horror disgusting. I know some people enjoy that kind of thing and treat it as ASMR, but for me, it triggers a condition where I scratch at my skin. Since every chapter you start in the game is prefaced with an ad, and these ads have absolutely zero foreplay (they just shove you in with the most abhorrent, wriggling, squirming things), I‚Äôm triggered to claw at my face every time I play.

On one hand, Maple can‚Äôt control every ad that pops up. However, I can just confidently say that unless ads that have this effect on me are removed or at least prefaced with a trigger warning, then I have to just stop playing. I can‚Äôt afford my physical health deteriorating after years of improving just because Maple can‚Äôt filter their ads better.

I‚Äôve been here since the beginning, and never once have I felt the need to complain or leave a negative review until now; I just hope that this can be turned around and I can go back to mindlessly tapping and turning off my brain for the day.

review:
I‚Äôve been reading the Night Prince series and of the course of the 3 books I‚Äôve read so far, I‚Äôm quite disappointed with the amount of spelling errors I‚Äôve run across. A couple once in a while isn‚Äôt a big deal but the TONS of errors while reading this series is off putting. Not to mention the fact that I spend diamonds for certain situations only to have it repeat the same scene multiple times because of the different choices that could have been made from previous scenes. So despite saving hunters life, the scene played out in the limo with Hunter then repeated itself as if Hunter died. What is the point in spending diamonds on certain scenes just for the book to not even recognize the choices we already made. I had to pay for the same diamond scene twice on multiple occasions. 

The story thus far has been great - plot wise. Play through, not so much.

review:
I love the stories, so much so that I pay for VIP membership, but half of the time I feel I‚Äôm not getting my full benefits. Reward page ads crash my game. Beginning of chapter reward ads crash my game. End of chapter reward ads crash my game. Maple coin ads crash my game. Sometimes the game will just crash with no ads at all. I‚Äôve even had it crash when I‚Äôve just left it on a single screen and haven‚Äôt touched it.

 It‚Äôs infuriating to feel that the money I put into this app isn‚Äôt worth what I‚Äôm getting, because ANY ad I try to view will crash and give me no rewards, and often will make ads unavailable for me for a while. I want to support this app, I paid money to support it and have more fun with it, but until these issues are fixed, whether with coding, server connection, or just vetting the ads to make sure they won‚Äôt cause any issues, I won‚Äôt be renewing my VIP. I wish I could get my 10 dollars back. Please fix this.
title: I want to love it, but I can‚Äôt.

review:
When I found this game, I was immediately hooked. I spent a lot of money right off the bat; bought diamonds and tickets galore so I could play as many of these interactive stories as possible. They were fun, but it was obvious to see the cash-grab aspect after the first story I played through. 

Nonetheless, I subscribed to VIP pretty quick and enjoyed the perks of discounted choices on completed stories and more earned rewards across the board. Problem is, through that entire month I was subscribed, I didn‚Äôt receive a single free generated ticket. It was promised I would receive 2 tickets every few hours. 

I contacted support and got a message back with instructions. I followed them and replied, then heard nothing. I waited a week, then emailed again. Got another reply from someone else with further instructions, which I followed and replied again. Heard nothing back. Another week, I sent another message and explained I was now no longer VIP and wouldn‚Äôt resubscribe until they rectified the issue. 

It‚Äôs now been 3 weeks since, and I haven‚Äôt heard a peep. 

That‚Äôs 5 emails sent to support, and 2 utterly unhelpful responses. 

I won‚Äôt pay them money ever again. If I use this app, it will be to garner book suggestions. I would rather give money to the authors of these stories than this company.
title: Fun for a While. Support Severely Lacking.

review:
I recently saw an advertisement for Chapters that had the EXACT same lines as in an Episode advertisement. These were along the lines of:

"OMG, is that my new hot neighbor?" 
What will you do?
- Bring over cookies.
- Enjoy the view.

The only difference, quite frankly, was that the graphics of the Chapters ad were much worse. I'm almost positive that the Episode advertisement was made before the Chapters one, since I've seen it several times in the past few months, but I just now, for the first time, saw the Chapters ad. I'm sure that other companies wouldn't appreciate direct plagiarism of their work, even if it was just an ad. I can also imagine that your readers aren't thrilled, either. Dirty marketing is never a good idea, and if it does somehow end up getting you ratings or money, in the end, it'll ultimately make your company look bad.

Not only has this came up, but the graphics of this game aren‚Äôt exactly the greatest, everything is extremely overpriced, and several stories are kind-of uncomfortable due to some creepy characters that seem like they‚Äôve assaulted someone within the last 24 hours.

Maybe I‚Äôll give this app a chance again, but things will definitely need to change. (Not that I matter specifically to this company, but several other reviews are reflective of what I have noted, which may turn out to be a major issue in the future.)
title: Coincidence?

title: Better than other story games

review:
I would love to give this game more stars, but I‚Äôm pretty disappointed. The content is fine, some of the stories are mind-boggling and yes the misogyny/misanthropy is very prevalent, but I digress; my issue is with the diamonds. 

As stated before, the choices do cost too many diamonds and having several per chapter makes you lose interest. 

Yes, I know that there are many ways to earn diamonds, however, after playing numerous quizzes and downloading at least 4 games I have yet to see them! I even followed the link on WhatsApp and‚Ä¶nada. 

It worked fine at first and before I get the back-handed feedback from other users and the app developers, I know it is a free game. Like many others have also stated, it just seems like there could be a happy medium. I would also appreciate an explaination as to why I have not received the diamonds that I ‚Äúearned‚Äù. By now, I should‚Äôve had enough to finish at least 6 books with premium choices. 

Yes I can go to another app and if I don‚Äôt receive a response or do receive a negative one I will delete the app as soon as I finish the stories I am working on. It‚Äôs not worth the dissapointment or disrespect and there will still be users waiting to shell out $120 a year aplenty.

review: So I have both apps- Chapters and Choices, so I‚Äôve used both apps to kind of determine what I like and don‚Äôt like about one or the other. With Chapters, I really like that you get rewards for being a loyal reader, it‚Äôs 30 minutes wait time for a ticket to read a chapter, and sometimes by making certain choices you get bonus diamonds. The problem in my opinion with Chapters is the storyline for most of their books. They all have the same kind of story line with someone having either a history of an abusive relationship or mean parents. And the love part of the novel doesn‚Äôt include any chase and often the characters seem so creepy. Most of what they say are not realistic AT ALL. In the story His, in the first chapter, one character is already talking about making some stranger he met ‚Äúclimax‚Äù. Wait, what? I‚Äôve also seen a lot of typos. So the rewards in the app are great but the rewards mean nothing if there‚Äôs nothing that‚Äôs really worth reading.

title: Gems Gems Gems so many gems...

review:
These stories are written in juvenile language. The characters are extremely one dimensional, and you can‚Äôt connect with them or relate to them at all like you can the characters in Choices by Pixelberry. Also, the game has A LOT of glitches: backgrounds and outfits will randomly change during one scene, the characters will repeat their responses or phrases, or other character responses won‚Äôt like up with the previous choices made. Also, in a couple stories I‚Äôve played, they must have changed a lead character‚Äôs name halfway through because that person is referenced by two different names. There are also a TON of grammatical errors. 

If this game wants to be half as good as Choices, then they seriously need to reconsider hiring more professional, advanced and mature writers and work on their character developments as well as uniformity throughout the stories. 

Also, it‚Äôs HIGHLY expensive, and more often than not, the free choice lands you the same outcome as the paid choices.
title: Subpar to Choices!

review:
I really wanted to give this a 4-5 star rating, because I actually do like the mystery/thriller stories. Unfortunately, the game costs too many diamonds for premium choices that don‚Äôt even affect the storyline. I can‚Äôt really complain about the amount of tickets since the refill time is only 30 minutes, but the timer for the tickets keeps resetting every time I open the app and doesn‚Äôt give out the tickets like it‚Äôs supposed to. It may just be a bug, but it‚Äôs driving me crazy.

The romances are absolute garbage. Several of them feature abusive (or at the very least highly toxic) relationships.c Many of them are HIGHLY inappropriate for readers under 18 (I do realize that the app is rated 17+; however, it makes me wish there was a higher rating). I‚Äôm a 21-year-old college student, and many of the scenes made me cringe. I felt like I needed to go to a priest and get my eyes cleansed with holy water, and I‚Äôm not even Catholic. 

I also noticed that there‚Äôs very little variety of skin tones, hair colors, and hairstyles. People like to make their character look the way THEY want him/her/etc. to look. That‚Äôs the whole point of a choose your own adventure story. You get to pretend to be the main character. So, the game definitely needs more variety in characters, and I‚Äôm not just talking about ethnicity.

Overall, it needs serious improvement.
title: *sigh*

review: I love the stories on here. I have a big issue with the diamond system, however. I don‚Äôt want to spend a bunch of money on choices that cost 17 diamonds and there being like 10 diamond choices in each chapter. They are stupid choices too. Like I can‚Äôt choose a nice outfit or a nice meal because I don‚Äôt want to waste 17 diamonds. I know I can complete offers to get more, but those are so tedious and they take a long time to accumulate that most people just don‚Äôt want to do it. I think that they should change the choice system. The choices should be cheaper or even add an ad option. I‚Äôm more willing to watch an adult to be able to choose a certain option than pay way too much. or better yet, just make day to day choices free and then the life or relationship altering choices a diamond choice.

title: One Ticket Every Two Hours Glitched

review:
This site is truly great. I love the stories, the passion, and the ability to transform it into my story. As a romance writer myself, I appreciate a good read and a deep storyline.  This is a site I highly recommend. 

However, that being said, I‚Äôm not happy about the cost of buying diamonds just to continue taking the story in deeper. There needs to be a better way to earn these diamonds, other than paying for the ‚Äúearn diamonds‚Äù partner section. I‚Äôve actually stopped reading for weeks at a time until the urge to pick it up again strikes me. 

I understand the need to support the site financially, but do it in a better way. I‚Äôve never seen a site as expensive as this. At first, I was buying the diamonds, then I tried some of their offers. Eventually I stopped reading all together, especially after seeing how much money I had wasted on a single story. In one story alone, I spent IVER $200!!!

WOW!!! That‚Äôs insane. Even my books don‚Äôt sell for that much, and I have written 26!! 

Try adding a game to earn diamonds, or watching long, boring commercials. Anything would bring more readers to your site. To be completely honest, I‚Äôm amazed that anyone would stay with this site for more than one chapter.

Otherwise this app is pretty fun and addicting - jam packed with several stories fitted for any and all tastes and preferences.

title: Best app ever!!

review:
I‚Äôve been using this app for a long time. I gave really enjoyed reading the stories. Yes, some have ridiculous options that make you feel cornered to spend 17 diamonds. Usually, up until the last couple of weeks, the ‚Äúearn diamonds‚Äù section had so many options to just click on the ads, rather then purchasing something from their sponsors to earn diamonds. But lately earning 2 is sparse and more complicated to actually receive the diamonds. 
I really liked how when you finished a chapter you were offered to watch a video to earn 4 diamonds total rather than 2. Now you have to watch a video in order to receive 2! 
Instead of being able to pay your ticket to read a chapter, you also have to play an ad from their sponsors.

That aside, the diamonds cost WAY TOO MUCH for a choice. Which makes jumping through hoops to save money to earn diamonds not worth even playing! 

They are becoming more sponsor oriented and idk about the rest, but it‚Äôs making me closer to delete the app. I hope that they go back to the way it was for the sake of their customers. 

I have liked their stories, which is why I haven‚Äôt given up yet. Here‚Äôs to hoping.

review:
I've been playing this app for a long time now. I have to say that it is one of the best story apps hands down! You earn gems making the right choices during the chapters and one gem when you finish a chapter. Also, the gem choices have only gone as high as 17 which is really good compared to other apps... Along with NO ADS!!!

The only suggestion that I have is, why not give an option for a subscription? Where you can pay month by month or even by the year to have unlimited tickets (not gems). Sometimes I get so engrossed with a story, that I often find myself having to wait 30 minutes for 2 tickets (some stories being 26 chapters long) and it takes forever to read a story.

I do spend money sometimes buying gems and tickets, but I don't always have the extra money to spend a of the time. Maybe if there were a subscription option, everyone who played the game could have the one time purchase option and wouldn't have to wait so long to finish a story.

Like I said though, this is the most amazing app and I definitely recommend it to everyone!!
title: Love the app, but have a suggestion.

review:
Let me start this off by saying THIS GAME IS ADDICTING. The stories are really entertaining and you really feel you‚Äôre the character. Unlike other apps, it‚Äôs really easy to get diamonds and it‚Äôs not overly priced. Sometimes things cost 10-12 diamonds, while others cost 17-20. Considering you get one diamond after you finish a chapter, it‚Äôs a pretty good price. Also, instead of waiting a ridiculously long time for tickets, it only takes 30 minutes to generate 1. Overall, this app is amazing!! 

One thing though. I don‚Äôt know if it‚Äôs just my phone or the app, but it keeps sending me back to my home screen. I can‚Äôt even get to the loading screen without it kicking me out. If this is a bug, please fix!!
title: Best Story App!!

review:
But it has the potential to be just as good. You have some things to fix, certainly. 

1.) Delete HiS. Like seriously, delete the entire thing and rewrite it. It is the most cringey thing I‚Äôve ever been forced to read. Kyle is absolutely detestable as a human being. Borderline assault-y. I‚Äôd be scared of him if he were in my neighborhood, near real children. Like. Ew.
2.) Lots of spelling mistakes for a game that is mostly about reading. I can understand one or two, but I‚Äôve definitely counted more than two. That, and quite a few punctuation errors as well. More than a game about reading should have.
3.) Weird emotions. The characters seemingly get angry over...nothing. Or sad. Or resentful. It‚Äôs very strange.
4.) Diamond ads. I can‚Äôt play the ads. I don‚Äôt know if that‚Äôs just on my phone or on everyone‚Äôs, but I‚Äôm unable to gain diamonds by watching ads and it seems a little odd that the offer is there and I can‚Äôt use it.
5.) The chat thing. There is more cussing on there than I could believe. Like, super disgusting vulgar things.
6.) Colored people. I have yet to see a dark-skinned character that isn‚Äôt like a burnt orange color.

Overall it is a good app. There are lots of stories that are interesting and fun and I‚Äôd still recommend the app.
title: Not Better Than Choices

review: The stories themselves are pretty entertaining however the app is very disappointing. You have the ability to earn diamonds which allows you to participate in the game. You were also allowed to win tickets and or coins.  The downside is even if you purchase diamonds somehow they get lost in each chapter that you start it‚Äôs rather annoying when you pay for something and it‚Äôs not there for you to use without explanation. Also, due to the nature of this app and the way that diamonds are required to interact, they should at least give you the courtesy as a reader and start you off with 100 diamonds to get through a story. Each action item is anywhere between 17 and 12 diamonds. This makes it almost impossible to participate. The idea is good, but the execution of this app isn‚Äôt the best.
title: Disappointing

It‚Äôs more like watching videos for every to get 2 diamonds those videos can last a long time. The get extra diamond links not all the links work and it takes longer to do that than watch a video.  The links with a lot of diamonds like never work I have tried once and never got it. Big waste of my time on that. I can get invested in these chapters but I can pick an option I would like because I have no diamonds to use after an other thing I decided to choose. review:
I quite enjoy this app! This an otome visual novel romance app. You get to play Girl x Boy (female romancing male) stories (majority), Lesbian stories (fewer) and Gay male romance stories. 

You get to customise your MC looks (white looks to dark looks) and also customise how your love interest looks like (same as above). 

The graphics are gorgeous and the book covers are awesome! Some of the stories are pretty well written. You pick choices as you progress through the story. Obviously the best options are the gem/premium ones.

You can actually play the stories for free if you are willing to play them slowly. You can get people to send you up to max 10 gems per day. You can watch adverts to get a certain amount of gems per day. And doing actions per day will get you maple coins.

Maple coins can be converted into choice passes which enable you to choose gem options for free. Every day, you get small amounts of coins/gems/tickets by logging in.

If you want to play faster, then buy gems. I‚Äôve spent quite a bit on gems since I was excited to finish a book. üòÑ I also love the lesbian stories. üíñ
title: Great App

review:
I had originally tried the game Episode but I was so disappointed with how it turned out. I ended up finding this app and have fallen in love with it. While almost all their stories involve love, there's so many different storylines. I'm a big fan of all of the supernatural stories and this is literally the only story app that has good ones. 
The other thing I'm pretty pleased with is the tickets and gems. The gems are somewhat annoying because you can pick certain outfits and responses without like 17, but you get one gem every time you complete a chapter. This is way more generous than any other story app. The tickets also refill super fast. 
Overall this is one of my favorite games and I'm super addicted to it.
title: The Best Story App!!!

review: I‚Äôve been using Chapters for almost two years and love the app, BUT... About a year ago they started using an ad platform that splits a basic :30 ad into 3-5 mini-ads that you have to actively click to cycle through and end to earn diamonds, daily bonuses, and end-of-chapter bonuses. It never worked properly, and it has *ruined* game play. The ad platform crashes and cheats you out of bonuses, and it often causes the entire app to crash. Today I‚Äôd make it through 3/5 mini-ads, and the ad (or sometimes entire app) would close. After the sixth time, I restarted the app only to have *it* close 7-8 times. On the off-chance the app loaded, trying to open a story caused it to crash. It‚Äôs not playable. This issue only ever occurs when the multi-ad platform is in use. Normal ads don‚Äôt affect the app.
title: Ad Platform Affects Game Play

review: This is an obvious money pit. Every major decision to go forward in the game is expensive and you have to make these decisions frequently. I know there are free options to earn more tickets and diamonds but every choice will cost either 17 or 12 diamonds. Its getting ridiculous!! I bought a few diamonds with real money to continue but I can‚Äôt afford to keep doing that. The stories are really well written and keep you hooked but it‚Äôs not worth hurting yourself financially just to read this interactive game. I‚Äôm extremely disappointed in how incredibly greedy the developers are how they don‚Äôt care about the people who read their content. Debating on whether to uninstall or keep using. Can‚Äôt afford to keep going much longer. It‚Äôs very sad.
title: Costs too much to play

review: I started and finished my first and last story. I was willing to give it a fair chance. Like all these games diamonds are used for premium choices. I purchased diamonds and used them here and there and still enjoyed the story. Til about halfway through. From that point the free choices made your character seem dumb, hateful, careless, and just plain stupid. Some even mocked you ‚Äúlet so n so bleed out and die.‚Äù The outcome was the same as far as the plot I‚Äôm sure but honestly some of the choices were deceitful. The very last choice of the story was basically happily ever after or divorce. I was just happy to be at the end so I could be done with this app and since I was out of diamonds I chose divorce. Lucky me they had a good laugh about my joke and had the happily ever after. My entire thoughts on the story is thank god it‚Äôs over. I‚Äôll be deleting this app immediately. Do not recommend.

review:

I used to read chapters when they first came out long ago and they were so fun until I got busy and decided to delete the app and focus on other things but they never had this many ads, it never costed so many diamonds or whatever to choose a certain option for how you want your story to go.

I have also been kicked out when I clicked the adds to skip the 30 min. wait to get to the next chapter. Hopefully this glitch is resolved quickly, because I normally really enjoy this app, especially the taptales portion.  When the glitch is fixed I can‚Äôt wait to fall back in love with the app.

review: I like the app since I have downloaded it. Unfortunately, there are always a few bugs, whether from the app or the phone itself, and sometimes have trouble loading. When it does, the stories breathe life. It‚Äôs almost like you forget what‚Äôs happening around you and immerse yourself as the character of the story. Even when making decisions, which cost diamonds which can sometimes seem a bit overpriced. The problem with the decisions, is that there seems to bee too many that cost those diamonds and you wonder if you should have spent the diamonds from the last decision or wait for the next. Other than that, I‚Äôm pretty much hooked. It‚Äôs a straight forward app and there‚Äôs not much to try to figure out.
title: It‚Äôs a good app for the stories....

review: Ok first of all, I really love the stories. They are nice to do go pass time. However, I do find it exceedingly difficult to get through a story when I don‚Äôt get the outcome I want. The gems only go so far, and you only get so many. There is an option to watch ads for 2 gems. And that was getting me part of the way. But when it got to the last gem than i needed, it exceeded to 23 minutes. I was so heated. I even like the choice passes, but I feel like it should be an option to buy choice passes for a whole story. I was really getting into my story when  the options came down to a few things. I couldn‚Äôt get the same outcome and it always seemed to be an outcome that wasn‚Äôt successful. I understand the game gets its money somehow, but it would be nice if the gems could stretch or at least unlock a whole story...

review:

Being a women of African descendant, my skin has much more melanin than the choices given and it was extremely disappointing that none of those choices were even close to that. Now I‚Äôm not sure if I am able to change my appearance later on in the game, but starting a game with absolutely no representation of my skin tone made me immediately delete the app. I do hope you guys take steps to have a bigger variety of different skin tones because I would really like to play, but so far all there is is white and white with a tan.
Thank you for your time.
