title: Leaves something to be desired

review: Pretty decent storyline with some spelling errors. But starting out with zero diamonds and everything costing 17+ diamonds for some of the random choices is awful. And to give 3 choices but two of the 3 choices costing 12-17+ diamonds leaving only one choice that isn‚Äôt outrageously priced. And they don‚Äôt even unlock anything special just basic choices shouldn‚Äôt cost so much. It‚Äôs not well balanced there at all. Storyline is good. Get the company is trying to make money, which I don‚Äôt mind spending if it wasn‚Äôt every turn you make costing so much. This creator decision has made me NOT want to actually spend real money in diamonds as it leads me to believe I would have to spend too much real money in order to make simple decisions within the story. So I‚Äôll stick with the free choices. If this ever changes I would reconsider.
title: Decent but diamonds are too high

review:
I‚Äôve read a few of the books, and honestly I‚Äôm shocked at the low quality. They‚Äôre disjointed. The stories, dialogue, typos, and editing make them feel like they‚Äôve all been done by 12 year olds. No one reacts realistically to anyone else; everyone is hyperreactive and dramatic. When they‚Äôre not yelling or making pubescent innuendo, characters are stiff like an elementary school play. Everything was ‚Äújust a dream.‚Äù People are in love suddenly with no development between them. Characters dramatically confess they know something, then a few chapters in are shocked to find out that thing they already know, and it shakes the chapter. Continuity is nonexistent.

I‚Äôm sorry to have to say it, but I do have to. Your quality is extremely poor. Your writers are children. Your content is lamentable. I‚Äôve seen better, less disjointed stories on fan fiction websites in 1999.

Please get rid of these writers. Your editors too, while you‚Äôre at it. The typos are a flood.
title: Juvenile writing

review: I love it it‚Äôs very easy to earn diamonds during the 2X time and during that time I can earn about 100 to 120 diamonds in one day, but there is room for improvement with repetitive stories and plots besides that I don‚Äôt mind the tickets and only having three as I am always on and off reading stories so I might use up all of my tickets and one time and then come back a few hours later and then use them again so it‚Äôs not like I‚Äôm having to worry about waiting around while the timer ticks down for us to get tickets again. And the first chapter is free with any new story so you can decide if you wanna keep reading it or if you don‚Äôt.
title: LOVE

review: I downloaded the app not expecting to ever even use it. But one day I decided to check it out and I find myself struggling to close the app and get back to reality. Unfortunately, I don‚Äôt have much spare change to spend on apps and you can quickly use gems making a steamy story. I keep trying to choose stories that look dumb or I don‚Äôt like the plot to build my stash, but keep falling in love with each one. I wish ads offered more gems or at the very least it would be nice if the amount of gems you have to use were cut in half. It‚Äôs hard to get into a story when you have to keep watching ads or selecting the free option which absolutely affects how the story will end.
title: Easy to get into

review: Honestly I‚Äôm not in love with all the stories, but I‚Äôm a pretty tough critic anyway. I wish there was more opportunities to name your love interests or possibly more opportunities to earn more diamonds since each action cost so much and some of us have kids and are really struggling with the COVID thing. However; all that aside. I love the backdrops for the scenes, even when the same scene appears in more than one book. I like the way you stay true to your individual characters personalities, even if it makes them dorky. I like your cliff hangers, it doesn‚Äôt just motivate you to the next chapter but adds an extra element of mystery. So concluding my little review I‚Äôll just say you have churned out some good works and I really hope to see more in this app for the future.
title: Like A Diamond

review:
I love this app! I‚Äôve had it for so many years, I can‚Äôt even remember now. But now that it‚Äôs the 6th anniversary of this game, I‚Äôve noticed the stories are better, more engaging, and exciting! It‚Äôs well worth the download! As an author, these stories help give me juice to keep writing my own books!

The only thing I‚Äôd change is how much diamonds cost to make choices when they come up. That‚Äôs the only downfall/sad part of this app is that to make a special choice in the story it costs a lot.

review:

I understand the point of making tickers and diamonds harder to get and in longer time span is to make money off of purchases but if you opted to purchase them, you would have to spend a ridiculous amount of money on just one story to even read it in a reasonable amount of time and with making even just some of your chosen choices. review:
My fianc√©e has been reading up Episodes &  Chapters recently and asked me to give it a try. 

When I first started off, I‚Äôd thought it looked like another series of boring romance stories like the ones you read in the Young Adult section with all the female readers drooling over Fantasy/Romance like Twilight (sorry girls). Of course, ‚ÄúAppearances can be deceiving.‚Äù

 You don‚Äôt have to read the Romance stories if you don‚Äôt want to. But if you do, there are three different categories of Romance: Steamy, Sweet & Paranormal. There are also different categories: Thrillers, Mystery & Fantasy (personally, I love Thrillers/Horrors) and I have found a great interest in the book, Hide & Seek! It‚Äôs got a dark feeling to it that I love!
title: Not going to lie, it was boring at first

review: This app has helped me rediscover my love for reading! I have tried other apps but none of them hold a candle to this app. I may not always like the story ending but I am consistently excited to read new stories, which are posted each week. This app will forever rank as one of the best ways to pass time with the ability to pick up where you left off when you have other things that you need to do. Another bonus is the fact that they provide tons of ways to earn diamonds if you don‚Äôt want to buy them, which is definitely a winner for me. This app may not be for everyone but it is perfect for me‚Ä¶

review:
*UPDATE* - 

I have not been able to get any stories to load for over a week now. I‚Äôve updated my phone and everything else and it will start to load, then shut the app down. Super frustrating!!!

I absolutely love the stories. I really wish there was a way to earn diamonds quicker though. And then it‚Äôs only 10/day. It would be great if the app developers would figure out a way that we could earn diamonds without it costing an arm and a leg. I‚Äôve had to wait weeks to finish one story before. üòê
title: Love the stories, but expensive to play

review:
I play lots of interactive visual story games and after a couple months of trying Chapters, I finally gave up and deleted it. Every time I finished playing I was usually in a terrible mood because of the short chapters, terrible choices, awkward writing, and ridiculous gem costs. 

I started playing Chapters for the steamy scenes, since most apps don't include the details. But to get the good stuff in Chapters, you have to slog through a lot of terrible content. I imagine the original stories are just fine but in being adapted to Chapters' format they become shallow. Plus you usually need to shell out a LOT of gems to get good scenes, and if you aren't trying to spend money that means endless mining on bad stories. 

But I finally reached my breaking point when I played FOUR stories in a row that involved graphic depictions of domestic violence/sexual assault and yet there were ZERO content warnings. I love stories about survivors healing and learning to love again but you can do that either without graphic triggering content OR providing appropriate warnings. 

And finally, they never show couples of color on the book covers. They are always white couples. After playing 20+ stories I realized that's unforgivable.

Not worth it for a random steamy scene that lasts 30 seconds.
title: Not worth it

review:
I‚Äôve been playing Chapters for a couple years now. Their support team is very nice and fixed an issue I was having pretty quickly, and I really enjoyed the app and how easy it was to get coins and diamonds. 

Unfortunately, I had to take an extended break from all my apps and I just came back to it and boy, this is HUGELY ad based and the coins and diamonds are much harder to get. Wanna start a chapter? 2 ads. Finished a chapter? 2 ads. In the middle of reading a story and have to go respond to a text? 2 ads when you come right back to the app. Yikes. 

I really used to like this app a lot, but with how many freakin ads there are and how much more difficult it is to get the diamonds (and how many dang diamond choices there are in the books now), I can‚Äôt say I really enjoy it anymore. It‚Äôs a shame.

review:
So I am all about the romance, esp when there are LGBT options. This and Choices are on my phone. Right now it Starstruck and Kidnap  a princess because its focused on women. Have not come across the guy with guy options yet. But I have restarted starstruck in the mean time of waiting for updates!!!

review:
When I first discovered this game a couple of years ago, it was love at first read. Fast forward 35+ stories and the themes are redundant, the writing is mediocre middle school at best, the amount of diamonds earned versus the amount required for good decisions in each story are way out of balance...
There have been several times I have sat and watched four ads in a row to earn 100 maple coins only to have the game give me only 20 and a message ‚Äúvideo not ready‚Äù. I have also used a story pass on a story where I could read for 24 hours without using a ticket and the game still took my tickets on the story I had a pass on!
And now, the game constantly crashes to the point where it‚Äôs not even completely loading on my iPad. 
I‚Äôm calling it quits and uninstalling. It was a decent run but not worth the effort for me to keep it in my life.

review:
I am rating Chapters: Interactive Stories three stars.
Reasons:
1. I really like MOST of the stories on this app.
2. Out of the three Role Playing App games that I play, this one has the steamiest stories as far as language and maturity (which I am personally a HUGE fan of).
3. I just like everyone else who plays this game absolutely HATE HATE HATE how many diamonds It cost just for one special scene. It‚Äôs pretty ridiculous how much it would cost someone to choose every single diamond option offered in just one chapter let alone to spend that many diamonds (personal money) to choose every diamond option offered in the entire book. That adds up really quickly!
4. I gave this app a three star review based on Episode being my number one favorite role-playing game, followed by Choices being my second favorite, and finally leaving Chapters as my final and third favorite.
5. Episode is hands down my number one favorite wayy above the other two for the simple fact that it has entire bodies and actions in the stories. Another gigantic major bonus is the fact that you don‚Äôt need diamonds to play every single story because most of them are user created stories!
title: Average for a Role Playing Game...

review: I am so mad I want all of my money back! I get that some choices you should pay for, but for example, I spent THE REST of my diamonds to return a phone call to a guy in the book that DIDNT EVEN ANSWER....17 diamonds for what???? Then a few minutes later the guy comes (because he was already looking for her) and purposes..well guess what? I couldn‚Äôt say ‚ÄúYES‚Äù because I already used all my diamonds on calling someone that didn‚Äôt answer and then the book ends. This also happened to me too with another book on here and the girl ended up alone which is not what I wanted. You pay for choices that leads to absolutely NOTHING and then when you want to make an important choice you can‚Äôt do it unless you spend MORE money. It‚Äôs not right. I won‚Äôt be using this app anymore. Choices is way better. At least if I have to pay for my choice I know it‚Äôs not going to end up nowhere like this app.
title: Literally most annoying app ever

review:

Complaint..... I spent $10 in tickets to make sure I could read the entire book non-stop, and maybe another. I got tired while reading it and fell asleep. 

I tried to go backwards a bit but apparently that illegal. No back buttons. So I re-started the books and chose all the same ‚Äúfree‚Äù options.... I still had to spend tickets, regardless that I e read it before. And never tried to choose and extra diamond option during the second. Only fathonable reason I‚Äôd be okay with still spending money is if I chose different options. The fact I already read this story. Re-set it. And still was Nickle-n-dimed pisses me off!!!

review: I love all of the stories but I agree with everyone. Diamonds cost way to much and there is to many diamond options. You need to make more ways to get diamonds AND tickets. 2 tickets is okay but you should have a higher max of tickets when waiting. I would suggest 5 or more tickets as the limit. This way we can continuously read. Another issue I have is that I logged out of my account and then it wouldn‚Äôt let me back in saying that I‚Äôm to young? If I‚Äôm to young then it should have restricted it when I logged in with my Facebook account. I bought diamonds on that account so this is very unfair and is making me upset. But over all the app is amazing! I will continue to use it even though my account might be lost.
title: Love it BUT

review: I‚Äôve been reading and using a lot of interactive stories, and this is one of my favorites. I‚Äôd give it 5 stars if the stories were original (not based on books already published) and if we weren‚Äôt now required to watch advertisements for new diamonds/gems. I occasionally pay for extra diamonds and gems (btw it‚Äôs SUPER hard to control my diamond spending), but it‚Äôs ridiculous that I have to watch two advertisements in order to get two free diamonds after each chapter I read. I know that Choices requires you to watch adds if you don‚Äôt buy their diamonds/gems, so what Chapters has done seems really ridiculous. I wish Chapters would have the same policy about adds and diamonds as choices does.

title: One of my favorites on this app is Just Desserts.

The free option, instead of being neutral, are TERRIBLE. I don‚Äôt mind paying for clothing, but the dialog thing is wild. A least give us one exceptional option and two neutral ones. I feel like picking all the free options would get you nowhere in the story. Therefore I don‚Äôt want to play anymore. However if you‚Äôre rich you‚Äôll have a blast!

review:
I only downloaded this as part of an offer from an app that lets you earn money from trying apps.  

I hate romance movies and novels and always have.  I rarely make in app purchases.

I was hooked on the very first book.  I became seriously invested in the characters and the storylines.  I found myself completing offers to earn diamonds.  I even broke down and bought them three times so far.

It makes no sense to me how I can be so invested that I will actually pay money to get the characters to make the good choices.  But I‚Äôm that into it.  I don‚Äôt understand.

I am not a big fan of the tickets, and hate how the further you get into the story the choices that are free are terrible compared to the diamond ones.  I was so sad when I had to make the decision not to spend 20 diamonds for my character to turn down a marriage proposal.  I felt like I was actually breaking the guys heart.

So, yeah, I‚Äôve spent several hours completely immersed in this app that I was sure I would hate.
title: Extremely surprised

review: The App has good story lines, but often you cannot truly choose the path of the story because they have certain endings.   Also, my biggest complaint is that you can complete offers and NOT get your reward without going through their support.  They will NOT respond for DAYS!  It costs so much to choose options in diamonds, that you have to purchase the VIP and Diamond Card to get a break!  You will spend a fortune in money to get diamonds!  So, it makes sense to complete offers to get the diamonds!  Well, more often than not you will NOT get them awarded right away, and have to go through support!  If you got your rewards for offers completed, it would be a 5 star review!!!!
title: Good Stories but does not honor rewards

review: The stories are great but you constantly have to make decisions in the game. I enjoy that type of storyline. What I don‚Äôt enjoy is that you have to pay for each choice between 8-17 diamonds. Or you get one free choice which most of the time logically doesn‚Äôt make sense and goes against the storyline. For example you‚Äôve been flirting with someone the entire story then it‚Äôs time for you to kiss and the only free option is to run away. Like what?? Or worse you have a fancy dinner and the only free option is to wear sweats. Because of this my character is making some pyscho choices showing up to fancy parties in sweats, acting like a tease the entire time just doesn‚Äôt make any sense

review: I'm nearing the end of a story, and I'm so fed up with this app. The diamond system is ridiculous. Every desirable choice requires an insane amount of diamonds, which I wouldn't be too upset about if the free options were at least decent. The free choice is at a painful deficit compared to the outlandish 17-30 diamond option. It‚Äôs evident that the diamond option is the only means of driving the plot to a desirable place. Still, we‚Äôre hit back to back with these same scenarios of a painfully dry option or an exceptional and enticing one, but one that will cost you an absurd amount of diamonds. Meet your players in the middle and give a 3rd option that isn't as devastating and off-putting as the free option. It‚Äôs not fun! I‚Äôm just skipping through the chapter because I know in the end, I‚Äôll get hit with another disappointing decision.

But it was literally only 7 days, no re-set, no bonus for continually logging in. I‚Äôm done with the app. It‚Äôs just a money grab. 

The new update makes it take 2 hours to get another ticket- yet still only banks 2 tickets at a time. It‚Äôs nice that they‚Äôre making more ways to get chunks of diamonds but each story only takes like 8-13 minutes per chapter so you‚Äôre done in 30 minutes and have to wait 2 hours for another ticket unless you want to pay.

title: Amazing

review: So I had this game installed on my phone for months and played regularly. I really enjoyed it because, unlike most of the story games, the premium choices were actually attainable and don‚Äôt cost an absurd amount of gems. Seemed really great until I got a notification from the app that receives  my blood sugar readings from my continuous glucose monitoring device, telling me that I would no longer get my blood sugar readings because I didn‚Äôt have enough storage on my phone. Confused, I went to my storage settings and looked to see what I could remove to free up some space. Charters was using 46GB on its own! The company is forcing the customer to save all the data to their personal devices instead of to a server. It‚Äôs a cheap way to run a business and as much as I love the game , it‚Äôs not worth keeping on my phone if it‚Äôs going to use up more than half of my storage space.
title: Storage sucker

Why would I spend money on extra packages for such short chapters? These issues need to be corrected and then I would give 5 stars.

review:
I like that this app gives you a diamonds at the end of each chapter and allows you to watch a video to earn a diamond. I still think the prices are a bit high for the better options in the chapters. I‚Äôve noticed that even if I choose the non-diamond option, it still moves the story along to where I‚Äôd want it to go.

There are a few downsides though. The first is choosing your character. There are only 4 options on how that character looks. I wish there was a way to choose face shape, hair length as well as color, nose shape, etc. All the other games I‚Äôve played allow that. 

The second thing is that most of the stories have the same storyline: girl gets cheated on/abused and falls for someone else. Not that original to be honest. And why does every girl end up in bed with the guy? It‚Äôs so explicit, too. Can a story be told without it always leading to sex? I‚Äôm not a prude but considering the app is rarer 12+, I don‚Äôt think any 12 year olds should be reading scenes like this unless there‚Äôs a warning before the book/chapter. 

Other than that, the newer stories are interesting. There could still be some changes made though.
title: Could be better

I wish there was some way that the developers could make it to where you can buy diamonds with Maples or trade diamonds in exchange for coins or Maples for those who cannot afford the VIP or to purchase diamonds. Other than that if you‚Äôre looking to buy time, be entertained, and dream a little than Chapters is the way to go.

review: At first, I loved this. It's one of the best story telling games I've played! The quality is better, and the writing is amazing. What I didn't realize is that every one of these stories is a real book that's published. The books themselves are great, but I'd rather spend four dollars on the penny dreadful then wait for more tickets, or panic that the book won't go the right way because I don't have enough diamonds. The format itself doesn't even make the writing better. It twists the stories for financial gain, and adds expressionless characters that have like 4 looks choices, crappily drawn backgrounds, and upbeat repetitive music that totally draws away from the intensity of the story. If you really need to visualize and this helps, go for it, but in any other circumstance, just buy the book or read it as a free novel online if you're really strapped for cash.

title: Would‚Äôve given 5 stars, but

review: I do love the app and the stories. Unfortunately, you get only 3 tickets and one chapter is 1 ticket. It‚Äôs frustrating when you get into the story and have to wait for it to reload. Another thing is, there are a lot of choices you get to make but the choices cost 12-17 gems (which is way too much) and the choices you get that doesn‚Äôt does any gems are always the opposite of what you want and it really makes it to where you don‚Äôt want to continue with the story anymore. There are also 3+ choices in every chapter and it adds up. It seems like the writers are getting a little greedy. If the option of choices cost little gems are give you two free options and one that cost, it would be better.
title: It‚Äôs a great app but‚Ä¶

review:
The story lines are really great and fun to read but you need ‚Äúdiamonds‚Äù to make certain choices in the story. I wish I could just buy the entire story instead. Let players buy stories, not diamonds please üôèüèª I would happily buy ‚Äúa book‚Äù after the first chapter or something and then I can play it a few times in a few different ways! 

It‚Äôs annoying as a reader to be asked for money in the middle of a story line. In the story I‚Äôm reading now, I‚Äôm basically being downright rude and disrespectful because I can‚Äôt afford the options I want unless I buy diamonds. I‚Äôm just not going to do that because I don‚Äôt know how many times I‚Äôll end up wanting to buy diamonds for one story. How much would one story cost me by the end?!
title: If you can‚Äôt pay, don‚Äôt bother

review: I have to say I love the choices app. I haven't been playing it long. However, I have read one story and part of another one. I don't mind the ticket or the diamonds.. I wish there was a better system when it comes to using them because as mentioned in another review, it could become rather costly. In both stories that I have read, I have found myself choosing choices that I wouldn't choose if I had the diamonds to spend. In a way it does keep me on my toes because you never know if your going to find yourself in more trouble because you couldn't choose the better of the three choices.

title: Best interactive story app

review: It‚Äôs actually really good- reminds me of what wattpad used to be like in its prime before all of the ads and unnecessary charges. I am kore of a causal player, was looking for some unique visual novels to assume me, since my fav one from Episode was deleted. The graphics are actually really good?!? It‚Äôs nice to see that some genuine care and effort went into making this. With places like a03 being hard to navigate because of the ill-fitting and abusiv3e they allow on the site, it‚Äôs nice to see a visual novel APP THAT IS CATERED towards women, that is actually unique, interesting and entrapped in light hearted fun. 5 stars from me :-)
title: Quite impressed!

review:
I think it‚Äôs the best story app. Most of the stories are pretty good for what it is. It‚Äôs a little easier to get tickets and gems than with other apps. I just wish 90% of the love interests weren‚Äôt billionaires, it immediately turns me off of the story. It also needs more lgbt and poc representation (although I‚Äôm glad there‚Äôs some at all). I appreciate the content warnings before certain stories as well. 

Like all story apps, most of the good choices require gems. Although it‚Äôs easier to earn them than in other games, it‚Äôs still difficult. I get that they want to make money but it feels excessive.

Overall, the app is okay. Don‚Äôt expect award winning writing or anything, but it‚Äôs an entertaining way, although frustrating sometimes, to pass time

review:
In order to get anything out of the app you need to spend money. The app makes you use diamonds for the better decisions and outfits. I read one story and was not pleased to find that my decisions were based on how many diamonds I had. You are given one diamond per chapter. So for a 12 chapter book, you‚Äôd get 12 diamonds.  Outfits cost about 12 diamonds. Big decisions that change the story charge diamonds for the positive outcomes cost even more. You either pay money or read a disappointing story and ending. 

The ticket thing isn‚Äôt great either.  You have to wait two hours between chapters. I waited about 36 hours, thinking that would give me a lot of tickets but came back to find they only added two. 

I deleted the app after about 48 hours with it. I‚Äôd rather just get a book.
title: You need money

review:
There‚Äôs barely any way to earn diamonds. I pay for the sub and STILL can‚Äôt always claim the double rewards THAT I AM PAYING FOR. And the ways to earn extra diamonds suddenly stopped working and hasn‚Äôt worked since‚Ä¶ it‚Äôs been several months at this point. I‚Äôve done everything on my end to fix it so it‚Äôs 100% an issue with the game. 

Without a way to earn diamonds, it‚Äôs become impossible to play the game without spending real money. The devs need to fix this because it‚Äôs almost not even worth playing it OR paying for the sub. It‚Äôs sad because it was enjoyable and you were able to earn diamonds to play more than one choice at a time. It‚Äôs ridiculous. FIX THE GAME!!!!!!

title: Love this game

review:
I first got this app and when I saw the home page I was immediately turned off. All I saw were girl meet boy scenarios and as a gay teen it just bugged me. I then saw ‚Äúmr and mr Smith‚Äù and It made me happy but that‚Äôs only one story about two men and I‚Äôd love to see more. I hope you will make it more inclusive, maybe by adding the option to choose your gender and choose if you‚Äôre straight,gay,bi,trans ect.
-
There‚Äôs also other problems, I get why outfits need gems to unlock but to not be able to choose the direction of the story is really annoying. This is meant to be a game where you can choose what happens but there‚Äôs hardly any choices to be made. Another thing is the tickets, I hate waiting two hours to finish one chapter. It‚Äôs a literal cash grab, I thought when I woke up I was going to have at least 3 tickets and I wake up to two. I‚Äôve never seen an app so stingy.
-
Can you please improve the home page, adding a search bar would help because I only want to read lgbtq stuff and I can never find it.
-
I hope you take these things into consideration and make it a better experience for others to enjoy as well as making money for yourselves.
title: There needs to be more LGBTQ stories

review: This was easily the best story app in the App Store. It refreshes with new lives every thirty minutes(short compared to other story apps) and you could watch videos to earn diamonds. The diamonds allow you to make better choices in the story. With this new update they have now limited the amount of videos you can watch PER DAY to four. It makes the game significantly less enjoyable. Every choice costs upwards of 12 diamonds. So it takes three days to make enough diamonds to make a choice. That is unless you play another story to make enough diamonds for the story you're actually interested in. I just think it's so unnecessary and definitely an attempt on their part to have more in app purchases. It's always a sad day when creative people put money before their consumers. Oh well... Guess I'll go back to choices instead.
title: Used to be the best...

review: I‚Äôve downloaded many other story apps and I must say that I‚Äôm impressed. I‚Äôm only on my first book but, it is nothing like the others are. The cost is down which is great. I would love to have choices on looks but maybe that‚Äôs the reason why the cost is great. Is a great app other than that minor preference of mine. review: I like this game and all, but really you don‚Äôt need to have diamond choices for every line choice the reader has (not literally). I mean there are times when you just have to loosen up and give that reader a choice on whether or not they want to flirt or go somewhere else WITHOUT diamond choices. I mean things that boost your character‚Äôs reputation or defense or the amount of time they hang out with their love interests is an exception for diamond choices NOT just lines that don‚Äôt really change anything in the story. I really wish that I could give this game a 5/5 but with this kind of thing with the unnecessary and too many diamond choices, I just have to give this a 4/5.
title: I like it! But...

review: I don‚Äôt have anything bad to say about it but I just wish that we could have more options on character looks. Also when it comes to buying things with diamonds, I wish they were cheaper. Some of the choices that cost diamonds are between 12-30 diamonds. I only get one diamond per chapter and I get two if I watch an ad. I only get two tickets every two hours. This does NOT add up. For the people who don‚Äôt want to spend lots of money on diamonds, they should get more diamonds per chapter or diamonds per day. That‚Äôs my request. I know you guys just do this for profit but please, I‚Äôm basically poor.

One story I read it let me pick the name of my love interest and it kept calling him Paul. Paul was far from the name I chose. Also almost the entire story was in the chicks thoughts. One thought would be ‚Äúwe have made so much progress together‚Äù then the next thought would be ‚ÄúI‚Äôm getting no where with him‚Äù. LAME
title: Awful. All over the place.

review:
It‚Äôs one of my favorite apps. I play/read every day and enjoy most of the stories. Sure. Some of them could be improved a little, and it can be expensive, yes, but it is so worth it, at least to me. 
I also like how they bring new things to try every time, like the Discover your Fantasy they have going these days. I am frankly addicted to it and I hope they will consider leaving it (please, please, please!), I‚Äôm already freaking out at the idea of not having it. I am seriously loving it!
Thank you for so many nice stories. Keep up the great job!

review: Stories are interesting, I REALLY love to read, and this is a refreshing change in pace. The diamonds, however are sooo frustrating!! You get so few, and have to spend so many to actually make the choice you want to make, and they are WAAAY overpriced to buy considering how quickly you go through them. Worse yet, you can watch videos for diamonds, but you only get two and are limited to the number of ads (I think it‚Äôs a measly 5 ads) you can watch, and then you have to wait HOURS before you can watch more. They SERIOUSLY need to fix this. It is a huge downer. There should be no reason at all to be limited to earning diamonds by watching ads. If they changed this, it would EASILY be a 5 star rating!!!

review:
Good drama, but What the ads don‚Äôt show you is that you need to spend gems to pick the good options in the story. Each good option costs 12-17 gems, but you only get 2-4 gems (depending on whether you watch an ad) per chapter. Otherwise you will need to spend real money to get more gems.

If you don‚Äôt have enough gems, you are stuck choosing the bad options in the story such as telling a kid in the hospital that he isn‚Äôt your favorite patient, rejecting a kid when she wants you to be her god parent with the male lead, wearing causal clothes to a ceremony, or rejecting the male lead outright when he tries to make an advance. 

So, while this is a ‚Äúchoose your adventure‚Äù, it‚Äôs more like ‚Äúyour wallet chooses your adventure‚Äù. How much you are willing to spend will affect the outcome of your story. 

I have no problem paying for games but this just seems like a money grab. I can‚Äôt justify spending real money for a short story. And I don‚Äôt see the point in playing if I have to be mean person in order to continue the plot ü§∑üèª‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è

It‚Äôs a shame because the stories are good...I‚Äôve had the app for a while hoping they would somehow make it more fair and less of a money grabbing operation with the diamonds, but sadly it‚Äôs time to uninstall because the two or three times I DID make purchases I never got the right amount of diamonds if any at all and my support email to try and get the diamonds I paid for both went totally unanswered. It‚Äôs a scam people, which is pretty disappointing.

review:
First off, the stories I read are really good, but I was crushed when the final choice to be with the love interest required diamonds and a no option was free. Selected no because I didn‚Äôt have enough diamonds, thinking ‚Äúthey will convince my character that I‚Äôm just being dumb and we have our happy ending‚Äù only to say we love each other but should be apart!? Final Choice! I actually got so mad that I couldn‚Äôt sleep. I buy lots of tickets. Why do I have to buy diamonds for things other than clothes or minor choices that don‚Äôt majorly affect the story?

Not a lot of stories, but the few I read were good. But I‚Äôm deleting because of the nickel and dime aspect. You get hooked and need to buy diamonds (or don‚Äôt waste the free ones too soon) to get a happy ending!
title: Happy Endings require diamonds!?

review:
First of all, the bad, there is a lot of money to be spent here. I mean all the sensible choices are at a cost of diamonds. You only get the finished card if you get all the cards; including the ones that require you to spend diamonds. Uh what?  Also, there a a QUITE limited amount of stories here, in fact, more in Wishlist than are actually available to read! Something else, I personally think that the public should be able to create their own stories, so that there'd be more content for us to read.   ü§¢üõëü§¢

Second of all, the good, of the small amount of stories, all of them are amazingly written, thank GOD! There are a few poorly written but I'm glad I just used my free first-read on them.üòç üíúüòç
title: There's Good and Bad

review: I tried, but the lack of meaningful choices made me crazy!!! No matter what I picked, within a paragraph or two I was right back in exactly the same narrative. The app is fine and their model may have been ok in the past but these days there are SO MANY newer apps out there where your choices dramatically affect the plot and with graphics that are so much more advanced than these, usually with beautiful CGs.  You don‚Äôt automatically romance anyone by default but meet many potential Lis in the context of the story and CHOOSE who to build a relationship with/friendzone/become enemies with. If I‚Äôm going to grind for diamonds by watching ads, I‚Äôd rather do it for something like that, because the quality is just so much better.

review:
Pros: Great stories, Huge variety, free diamonds.
Cons: daily rewards reduced resulting in fewer coins to exchange for diamonds.
Each chapter has several choices requiring diamonds. Choices are back to back and too ridiculous. For ex. ‚ÄúDo you love me?‚Äù  ‚ÄúYes (uses diamonds)‚Äù. ‚ÄúAre you sure you love me?‚Äù  ‚ÄúUm I just said yes two seconds ago! My mind had not changed in such a short time.‚Äù 
I get it! Reduce the daily rewards, free spin and force folks to make purchases. Brilliant but slimy scuzzy, and down right low! 
If you are going to force readers to make so many choices that require diamonds the least you couple do is keep the daily rewards the same or being back daily spin.

review:
Update: I contacted the devs directly and they couldn‚Äôt help me. They made no efforts to fix anything beyond a basic ‚Äúwe will check around‚Äù party line. I‚Äôm disappointed in their lack of follow through. I keep checking to see if things have returned to normal, but thus far, nothing has changed. 

I like this app a lot because I like silly stories and having some control over the way a story goes is fun. However, for several days I‚Äôve not been offered an option to earn diamonds for watching ads, which ultimately has made me walk away from the game. I‚Äôve paid for diamonds before, but I supplement my purchasing by viewing ads daily and it seems unfair to completely strip away the option. I‚Äôm not sure if this is a bug or not, but until this is solved, I‚Äôve moved on to other story apps.
title: Ads and diamond discrepancy.

review: So, I was in complete and utter love with this app. The stories are amazing, the achievements easy to unlock(mostly) and the whole app was like a gem in all these money-grabbing games. But then they had to get rid of the free diamonds. You see, you need diamonds to do certain choices, or even wear certain clothes. They had a feature where you could watch adds to get free diamonds, instead of paying. But they got rid of it!! Now, you have to pay to play the way you want to! And I will not stand for it. If they fix that and put the free diamonds back in, I‚Äôll rate a five star. Until then, I‚Äôll be deleting the app as soon as I‚Äôm done writing this. Good story game, though, so it still gets three stars.
title: In love, but Update RUINED it

review:

I live that there are badges , if yu connect your social media to gain more diamonds and also that once yu finish a chapter you don‚Äôt have to wait for regenerated tickets in order to play all over again ! (Important to note that the regeneration of tickets is only 10-30 minutes where as Choices is 1.5hrs ... always hated that! ) 

Chapters is FAR MORE FAR !

review: hi everybody! i just wanted to say my opinion on this app. i am genuinely very intrigued by this app in so many different ways!! i love it because when i‚Äôm bored or when i want to pass time, i start reading one of the stories and just can‚Äôt seem to get enough of them lol. on the other hand, i think that there should definitely be more ways to earn TICKETS or DAY PASSES, because the diamonds don‚Äôt seem to be much of a problem for me, but i am always running out of tickets. that‚Äôs it for my review but yeah chapters, you should definitely create more ways to earn tickets or day passes!
title: the app

review: I had a fun time reading and interacting with the stories and all. And, Im in full support for the writers and artists who put these stuff together. However, the amount of money I had to spend on two stories that i read estimated about almost 100$, no exaggeration. You have to put a ton of money on this app to freely navigate your (desired) choices on the story. IT WAS TOO MUCH, and NOT fair for the readers (who actually want to support what you guys are doing). Please!! the monthly subscription is not even enough to cover you to finish one story, Don‚Äôt even think about reading multiple stories. This is pure GREED. It could be better. This is not how you reach out for readers for a good story telling method. You guys need to throw out more diamonds for people who support you!!
title: Greedy app.

review: I love the app itself, but I found myself logging onto it less and less bc I was tired of constantly spending money on diamonds to be able to get the good version of the stories. But since the latest update, they have put a lot of effort into making diamonds easier to get (daily bonus, login bonus, etc) which has got me actually wanting to login frequently once again. The stories are amazing (for the most part), and some manage to still have a good storyline without spending your diamonds. I love this app sooooo much better now
title: Soooo much better now

review:
I really love this app, but there has to be a better way of earning diamonds than having to spend real money. 
You can‚Äôt go around asking for so many diamonds per so many choices plus outfit choices. That‚Äôs asking too much from your loyal readers. 

Suggestions:

-Give more diamonds per advertisement videos watched.  
-More diamonds rewarded per chapter read + bonus diamonds if you selected premium choices throughout the chapter. 
-Diamonds rewarded after finishing a book. 
-Daily login rewards 
-Daily challenges
Examples: 
*chapter quizzes* 
*‚ÄùWho am I‚Äù guess which character from what chapter book*

Have the readers interact more within the app to be able to earn diamonds. 

I love how much the app has improved within the last few months. With all new stories added weekly, better illustrations, more character diversity and style options, I want to be able to enjoy the choices without it being a burden on my wallet. 

Sincerely,
BrokeBoo
title: Love Costs

review:
Set up exactly the same way as "Choices." Which I do actually like. I love the stories & plot lines & your choice of genres!!! My BIGGEST problem is the amount of diamonds needed to pick the better of the choices your given. If you want to charge diamonds that's fine; but can't you charge 5 diamonds per choice instead of 17!!! Those diamonds are really expensive: $5=60‚ô¶Ô∏è‚û°Ô∏è that's approx. 3 choices 
Every chapter has as least 3 choices- which means you're essentially paying $5 per chapter- each story has between 15 & 30 chapters! Bare MIN. you would spending approx. $75 to read one of the shortest stories available (I believe there is only ONE story with that number of chapters) SMHü§¶üèº‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è....BULLS***

So when you pick your story and it loading.. It wont load!!üò∂üò° This gets on my last nerve. I even reseted my device to make sure it wasn‚Äôt me. title: Fix this !!

review: Really creative and entertaining stories that really demands your attentionüòç I just wish it wasn‚Äôt so hard to acquire diamonds, as there are different options to choose from which will make the story take a turn in the opposite direction depending on what you choose, but the only good answers all cost 12-17 diamonds which is very expensive seeming how it‚Äôs not very easy to get diamonds unless you spend real money. title: Overall very entertaining app! Just have one issue with it

review: I have literally tried every interactive story app, this one is by far the best. They have great storylines, and not all of them have happy endings... but if they all did would it really be that fun? You can‚Äôt always have what you want in real life and it‚Äôs realistic in that way as well as the pictures! They are also getting a lot better at outfit choices and features without having to pay so many diamonds, and have lots of good ways of gaining tickets and diamonds without having to pay unlike a lot of the other apps! Definitely recommend this one :)
title: Awesome App!!

review: This is by far my favorite story app, it gives us more adult themes since most of us that really love this stuff are late teens and adults. So happy to be playing again. I think my favorite thing is that Chapters uses actual books written, so when we find a story we love we can always go grab that book afterwards.

review:
The game was do-able before they put in ads at the end of every chapter. It takes forever to build up diamonds just so you can make one good choice through the whole book. Since most of the stories are based off real books, I found it‚Äôs easier to just get the actual book and save yourself the trouble.
Also, some stories, it seems that it doesn‚Äôt really matter what you pick, the outcome is the same. It may change the scene a bit but overall doesn‚Äôt effect where the story ends.

review: It‚Äôs a great app, the very first story I played was amazing! Unlike the other interactive story apps I‚Äôve used like this, the stories I‚Äôve read on this one actually have depth. I felt like I was actually reading a story I would in a book. The only thing I have to complain about would be gems. They require so many diamonds for each choice, it‚Äôs as if they‚Äôre to trying to squeeze every penny out of you. Premium options come up at least 3-4 times a chapter and they‚Äôre 17 diamonds each, so you run out fast. I get they have to make money, but if they could lower the amount for the premium options we‚Äôd get more bang for our bucks when buying diamonds.

review: The stories are beyond amazing and they keep me hooked every time. However I am so sick and tired of the rewards system. I already don‚Äôt get to play as many chapters but the option to watch an ad after a chapter to get more coins for free is bothering me. Every time for two stories in a row every ad that I was supposed to watch either glitches out or never loaded even after I would wait 10 minutes and then I just get no more gems. How am I supposed to pick the choices needing gems if I‚Äôm broke and can‚Äôt purchase any? I don‚Äôt know but it‚Äôs just very annoying. Over the stories are still top notch but those dang ads for gems...
title: Quality content... sucky rewards

review: I cannot get into a story that I myself can‚Äôt even be a part of. I have downloaded and deleted and re-downloaded it in the hopes something was updated to maybe allow some sort of customization that could put me into the story. The fact that In this society the developers didn‚Äôt acknowledge minority groups at the beginning says something about the continuity and relevance of this app. Since choices and Episodes allows people to customize their Characters, it‚Äôs jarring that there is a game that most of the stories show only a white female. Maybe later should the developers allow for more diversity. I don‚Äôt really think any story is great enough that I will still play it without customization.
title: Lack of Diversity is Jarring

review: The stories on here are great and they have you clicking on the chapters fast enough to wanting more and more of the story. Yet, wasting diamonds for specific clothes or perfect lines is sooooooo annoying. It makes you not want to continue playing because you want the episode to go great but you have to reject and go with the answer you not satisfied with. I really want that to change , I would much rather prefer the clothe option for diamonds but not the dialogue. It‚Äôs pointless. Also, making the diamonds a lot cheaper would make this app 100x better. It takes such a long process to raise enough diamonds to just loose them in one go. Please fix that !
title: Awesome .. but

review: No point in this. DELETED! Buy $2 worth of coins or finally get enough to make a SINGLE CHOICE AND THEN ITS GONE whats the point. I dont get these games. Dont they want consumers to download their app and continue using it? Whats the point of making a single choice 17 gems? The user then loses interest in the story because they cant control it, theres no point in it at all. Its not an interactive story. Its just a story. One star to all apps like these. Especially this one because you guys think you‚Äôre being nice but it‚Äôs just plain condescending to only allow 4 gems after watching 30 secs to one minute videos. How much are you making from those ads? Enough to allow us at least a few gems per video. And if we buy the gems, itll be worthless because they run out so fast.
title: Horrible scam

review: I love games like this and choices , but this game leaves something to be desired if you‚Äôre not a white female. I have played multiple stories where my options for an avatar were all white females. And the one that didn‚Äôt still looked like a white woman with slightly darker skin tone. This game lacks diversity. Also , I first appreciated that it‚Äôs cheaper to play than choices. But it‚Äôs actually not. Each chapter has multiple chances to spend diamonds but a lot of times it‚Äôs a waste of money. I played one game where you had to pay 17 gems to answer the phone. Then she DROPS the phone , and you have to pay another 17 end for her to answer it AGAIN. Things like that really irk me
title: It‚Äôs only okay

review: I honestly have enjoyed this app very much. The generation of tickets is less time consuming compared to the competitors which is very appealing. My favorite book so far has been ‚ÄúKidnapping the princess‚Äù due to its interesting lgbtq plot. Yet the only problem is that the app crashes way to often for me. I would wait 30 for another ticket then as soon as I click the next chapter to read the app crashes. As I go back to click on the story again it says I have no more tickets even though I haven‚Äôt even played the chapter. This is one of the main issues for me but other than that this app is wonderful. Please fix this problem soon. Thank you.
title: It was good but..

review:
Normally I‚Äôd gravitate toward the full on romance stories with an app like this, but I‚Äôve read three stories so far and for the most part I liked them. Most are too steamy, predictable, or unoriginal but the few I‚Äôve read have been good. In the middle of Uninvited- loving it.
Most choices that require diamonds usually end up not mattering much as far as changing the story- for the most part, using diamonds for a choice will get you achievements and trading card- type images related to the story.

title: Liking the suspenseful ones

review:
I love all the stories that I have read on this app!! They are all captivating and sweet. I paid for the VIP which is $9.99 a month, but i don‚Äôt like how I have to keep paying for diamonds to choose certain options, it feels like it‚Äôs defeating the purpose of being able to choose. The options would be as extreme as .option 1.: be in a relationship with him (pay 12 diamonds). option 2: just be flirty (pay 8 diamonds). Option 3: yell in his face with anger. 
And obviously I would pay for the better options. You also have to pay diamonds for nicer outfits. Then you have to pay a ticket to go to the next chapter. After spending $30 and 180 diamonds for an amazing story,  I decided to cancel my subscription!

review:
Pros:
- Diverse range of MCs that you can choose from.
- I like how there are Rated R stories for 18+ readers. 
- The characters (Especially the love interests) in these stories are much more memorable ex. Daemon Black, Seth Wolf, Fenris.
- I LOVE that you can talk with other readers in the comments right below the story. It gives you a sense of community and you can discuss what happened in the book. This is something Choices greatly lacks.
- I prefer stories that have direction, and not so focused on different endings (Some people like this, but I don‚Äôt). I feel like stories that have complicated branching like Choices miss out on a ton of detail because the author focuses too much on how many paths there are.

Cons:
- Too much contemporary romance books and not enough sci-fi, paranormal, thriller, and mystery books.
- Gem choices are too expensive. I feel like they should offer better Gem and pass sells for readers.
title: Much better than Episode and Choices, Memorable love interests

review: I love story apps like this. The only annoying thing about it is the diamond system. It‚Äôs annoying that you can‚Äôt choose what you want to choose because choices are locked behind diamonds that are so much just for one choice. You definitely shouldn‚Äôt have to use 17 diamonds on one choice. I don‚Äôt have money to buy diamonds all the time and the VIP/premium thing is annoying as well. I enjoy reading the stories but not so much anything else. And I see a lot of automated replies saying ‚Äúwe offer a lot of free ways to earn diamonds.‚Äù Not really. Very little amount of diamonds when choices cost 17+.
title: Love..Don‚Äôt love the diamonds

review: Great stories! I love this app and switch daily between Choices and Chapters. The soundtracks used by Choices is far superior to Chapters. You guys really need to work on your music. It‚Äôs pretty terrible in most stories. Also, even when you make diamond decisions, it doesn‚Äôt change the outcomes. When I make a choice, I like to see it followed through like I do in Choices. Your diamond choices can get very expensive, as well. It shouldn‚Äôt cost $50 a book. Some characters can be super passive aggressive and there is no changing it. Get that fixed, and you guys would get a 5 rating!

I got halfway through it, went to open and continue the story later, and it was stuck at loading screen with ‚Äòno resource upgrade‚Äô. I had to delete and redownload it and all my diamonds were gone. Worse, all my progress was gone too. That‚Äôs a big issue for only having the app a few days. To lose a paltry sum of diamonds that would have afforded me 2 or 3 important choices plus my current story? Glad I didn‚Äôt pay for the diamonds. Now I definitely won‚Äôt buy them since I read this isn‚Äôt a rare occurrence- the app not loading and needing to be deleted and reinstalled.
title: Lost all progress

review: Some of the stories are really interesting, my favorite so far is the boy I hate, I loved reading the book and then they brought the characters to life through this app. There are a few bug fixes needing to be done, such as if you choose your own name sometimes the suggested name is brought into the story in lieu of the name you chose. I wish there was a shorter time limit on the wait for tickets and that there were more stories, but other than that, most of the stories are interesting and very different compared to episode and choices.
title: Not bad

review: Out of the different stories app that I have downloaded, this is probably my favorite. It‚Äôs the easiest to earn diamonds without paying, there are some good stories and nice art. Some complaints that I have are the occasional ridiculous or repetitive diamond choices, a few stories having some points that don‚Äôt make sense, and my biggest issue is how quickly this app drains my phone battery. With no other apps running and my brightness all the way down, it‚Äôs crazy so fast I need to find a charger.

review:
Kind of angry I had 50 diamonds chose a option for 17 diamonds and then was only left with 17 diamonds. I‚Äôm no mathematician but I‚Äôm pretty darn sure it should have been 33 left. Plus making the choice for 17 to try and understand the story just a little more got me no where besides a dead end. Any common sense option will cost you diamonds and when you do manage to buy one it doesn‚Äôt help!

I refuse to pay on a free app so if I have to make dumb choices I guess I will. I mean I have read almost all of the writings available and it always ends badly because you have to pay. Oh well at least it passes the time but with taking away that many diamonds in one choice I‚Äôm pretty glad I didn‚Äôt put money in or I would be very angry!

review: This app is absolutely STUNNING the artwork is beautiful and user interface is so organized and easy to navigate. I moved away from the Episode app because the artwork became outdated and he stories were rudimentary at best. I primarily use the Choices app now and this app definitely is a competitor. The only issue is that this app is sadly not inclusive. Sure there‚Äôs skin and hair options that include a pretty wide ethnic variety but Asian options are lacking and there‚Äôs no stories that allow for you to play as a boy and create LGBTQ+ stories by doing so. The stories only allow/encourage the player to be involved in heterosexual relationships. Pretty sad to be honest. Hopefully there‚Äôs more in the future.
title: Good but...

review: So many of these story apps are amazing, but so many of them have costs associated. This one is no exception. I love the stories and feel that a lot of my own mental wounds are starting to heal, however, this one has costs at every turn. It stinks that the ‚Äúgood‚Äù choices always cost diamonds and the ‚Äúbad‚Äù choices are free. I get that the authors need to make money, but why is there only one free option that is usually the worst one and always 1-2 good options that cost diamonds?
title: Love the stories, some of them are quite healing, but why do I have to spend so much.

review: This is a great game which will allow you to relax and watch as time goes by! You have the option to anything and you can collect diamonds and tickets to read actual books animated. The books are divided by chapters and you pay a ticket for every chapter you read! Some options you can buy with diamonds and others are free, but over all, better than any other game, for example: Episode. I would recommend this game/app to anyone that loves to listen to books, but doesn‚Äôt like te read much or gets bored easily!
title: Great Game

review:
This has to be one of the cheapest story games I‚Äôve seen. The game crashes constantly so that it‚Äôs barely playable, the writing is like what would happen if a preteen decided to start writing lazy fanfics, and, probably the worst part of the whole thing, YOUR CHOICES DONT ACTUALLY MATTER. In one story, the girl was constantly lying to her friends about her relationship. The option not to lie cost gems. I figure, ‚Äúokay, I‚Äôm going to support this game, spend $2 for some gems, and maybe this story will stop sucking if the character does something believable.‚Äù But NOPE. I literally wasted $2 of my real money for the character to back out and lie anyway! 
In my opinion, don‚Äôt waste your time or your money. Choices is a much better story game, and this is basically just a cheap knock off version.
title: Seriously Annoyed

title: Great game but....

review:
A reader is supposed to be awarded with 2 diamonds after each chapter. In the past several weeks, because of some glitch, I have lost out on at least 150 diamonds. I normally wouldn‚Äôt complain because they‚Äôre free - just watch an ad, but the app requires so many diamonds per chapter that reading one book can cost hundreds of diamonds (which, if one were buying the diamonds, would add up to at least $99 easily spent on a book if a reader wanted to open up all select choices). Who would consciously spend so much on a d-list book??

The writing for most of the books is subpar. I have found 4-5 out of dozens that are pleasantly readable and enjoyable. It could be much better than it is.
title: False crediting

I feel like they tried to copy Choices but failed miserably!! I‚Äôm not even gonna mention the gems cause this review would be too long. And the only skin color they have is white. That is very inconsiderate. I‚Äôve had Choices for about 2 years but this app won‚Äôt even last 2 minutes!! The second you start the book it throws you straight into the story. No build up or anything! Don‚Äôt waste your time. I think the ad is better than the game!!!! They should make no stars a thing.

review: As many other reviewers have mentioned, the diamond system is annoying and unfair. You can‚Äôt acquire enough diamonds to select your actual choices without spending lots of your own money which I‚Äôm not willing to do. So you end up choosing very little of what you want which takes away from what actually makes these types of apps fun: the ability to lose yourself in relatable characters. The storylines tend to be very similar which is the other big barrier for me in being able to get swept up. I would love to see some real variety in subject matter and much greater diversity in characters.
title: So much potential, but...

review: Solid game with some good stories, though I wish there were more LGBTQ+ stories (only 3 out of hundreds). I bought a day pass because one of the LGBT stories had me hooked, but I wasn‚Äôt as interested in the hetero- stories though I tried several with different themes. The diamonds are costly (used for various choices or certain outfits) but I could gain enough from watching ads every chapter. I would play more often (and maybe even buy more) if there were more stories that interested me where the characters were more representative of minorities.
title: Wish there were more LGBTQ stories

review: I like the stories and I do often spend my money on this app to get the best choices. But why is it so expensive? To complete a story requires so many diamonds. (There‚Äôs also about 50+ choices per story) And even if I want to spend money on more, it‚Äôs $1.99 for only 20 diamonds!! roughly $2 per choice!? There‚Äôs no way to play this game without inevitably spending hundreds of dollars to try and enjoy it. In addition, there‚Äôs no way to replay the same story you read and paid for without paying for choices AGAIN. It‚Äôs robbery! I think the creators should value their customer more. Disappointing.

So I‚Äôm used to playing ‚ÄúRomance Club‚Äù where they give you diamonds every 2 hours if you watch an AD not to mention they give you diamonds after each chapter you finish and more diamonds for coming back to play every day‚Ä¶..And More Diamonds when they have ‚ÄúDiamond Rush‚Äù which gives you all diamond decisions for free for 48-72 hours. Just to show you the REAL difference here.

With this game they literally don‚Äôt give you any diamonds unless you spend real money to buy them or you have to do something for one of their sponsors in order to get free diamonds, it‚Äôs a little ridiculous if you ask me. 

The graphics are good, the stories are a little cliche but it‚Äôs almost unenjoyable to play this game, because every decision you make involves using diamonds, which makes you hesitant because you‚Äôre worried about saving your diamonds for a future decision that might be better.

review:
I've always been a fan of getting "extra" (Maple) Coins, Diamonds & things like that IF it meant I had to watch an ad. 
For the  past 3 weeks or so (give or take) when you watch an ad for the 60 Maple Coins you have to spend about a minute or so "watching" the ad - which is fine I'm OK with that.
But once the ad is finished you'll tap on the "x" in the corner to get the reward - the 60 Maple Coins & wait for the next reward.
But now.. when you watch an ad for the 60 Maple Coins the ad doesn't go away - it stays on the screen meaning there's NO "x" in the upper corner. Tapping on the screen doesn't make it show up or bringing up the all the opened apps then going back to the Chapters app doesn't make the "x" show up either. So you have to completely close (exit out of) the app & re-open it again, which is crazy.
It's a pain.. I would rather get the free (40) Maple Coins without having to deal with an ad that won't go away.
FIX ASAP!!! (FYI - iOS is up to date but this started before the last 2 updates were released.)

review: Of all the story apps I use, this one is my favorite. Although the premium options do get a bit pricey (and you might not get the ideal ending without using diamonds), I think that the app does a great job of giving you diamonds (1st week login, 2 for completing a chapter, & up to 5 diamonds per 30 minutes for watching ads). The waiting for tickets can be frustrating sometimes, but rewarding. There are so many great stories to choose from and more are added every week. I love this app!
title: Great app, fantastic stories

review:
I really love this game, the thrills, the titillation, and the dialogue. Able to play it safe, or be a seductive teasing version of yourself.
I have paid several times to progress because I love playing it, but wish there were less diamond forward progression, and more ways to earn diamonds without falling into the ‚Äújust click here‚Äù, ‚Äújust download this‚Äù, or ‚Äúsubscribe/buy this‚Äù. 
Click bait is a known term, and I don‚Äôt want this to fall into that category because I could play endless stories and be enthralled.

review:
This is the best story app I have used thus far. The books are amazing and tickets rejuvenate every 30 minutes which is great. 
I do not like how all the good choices are just out of reach costing 12 or more diamonds. All the good choices cost several diamonds including clothing, but you only get one diamond for completing a chapter. So it makes it a little hard to make the story good and choose what you want, but I think it is worth it.
Also, I cannot figure out how to share so I can get my influencer badge!
title: Best yet!

review:
The stories are very good, considering the ones in these kinds of apps. But the currency is a problem.
I understand the amount of budget you'd have to have to keep such cool features in an app (the art, the stories, the contests) but the use of the in-game currency is downright unfair. You need an absurd amount of gems to get all the good choices and you can't get them organically as they also limit your means to do so (like watching ads). And most of the players say this in game, in the reviews and in every social media, which can only bring me to the conclusion that the developers just don't care as much about their community as they say they do.

Suddenly somebody says something that doesn‚Äôt make sense or flow with the story, topics seem to change out of nowhere; and sentences are repeated a lot. Things are not always explained well enough when this happens. title: Love

review: I understand that having paid, diamond choices are how the app developers make their money, but too many diamond choices for every decent decision involving the main character, really takes away from the quality of reader‚Äôs experience. It just makes people feel annoyed, frustrated and want to close the app, when EVERY other choice requires 17 diamonds. Not only that, but it makes the app developers come across as thirsty and money hungry. I hate to say it, but the Choices app on iOS does it better. Take lessons from them if you want to to learn how to run a good stories app.
title: WAY too many diamond choices!!!

review:
This is completely ridiculous. Your advertisements need to be removed from the App Store and other games ASAP until they can be revised and more appropriate for all audiences. You just started displaying soft core pornography on my phone with extremely mature subject matter. Fortunately it was just me playing Tetris when this popped up, but it could have easily been any of my children. 

NEGATIVE STARS IF I COULD. 

If you enjoy this content good for you, but I don‚Äôt want to see this on my phone every few minutes. Find a way to advertise that is less extreme. A very sad reflection of your morals as a company when you are placing revenue and downloads ahead of common sense and decency.  I am not against your product, but am against the manner in which you advertise. Unfortunately this negative review is just a drop in the bucket compared to thousands of others who love it, so it is unlikely that any change will be made. This is a sad reflection of the state of our society. 

EXTREMELY DISAPPOINTED. 

APPLE NEEDS SOME STANDARDS IN ITS APP STORE.

That‚Äôs just one choice though. And outfits cost the same most the time. It would be okay if it was SOME choices, but this is every choice! But, this game does!! title: Review

review: This is almost an exact copy of the Choices app, but with bad plots. Have you not seen any of the complaints about Episode (another choose your story type of app)? We're sick and tired of bad boy stories and Mary Sues, among thousands of other things. So why copy that? Please, if you're going to make a choose your story app, at least make the basic efforts of designing the app in a way that is more unique and coming up with interesting, well written stories. And don't ask your readers to do that job for you. Sure, people can submit their own stories, but the stories already available on the app should at least show somewhat of a good example. Which is currently not the case.
title: Oh boy... Not this again...

review: From the ads that prompted the download, I thought you‚Äôd get to see the characters acting out the choices. Makes the ads very misleading. One small thing as player of color, it would be nice to see black and brown characters on the front of some of book covers. I don't mind waiting for tickets, but the diamonds are ridiculously expensive for the premium choices. If you don't buy them, the generic choices almost always have a condescending subtext.

Making me feel bad amount not spending enough money to play the game their way kind of defeats the purpose.

review: The stories are fun, don‚Äôt get me wrong. Enjoyed them and discovered new books that way. However the last month or so this app has gone down hill. Now whenever you have to make a choice in the game, the positive choice that advances your story always now costs at least 17 diamonds. The negative choice is free. So what‚Äôs the point of playing? They also just took away the diamonds you can earn by watching 5 ads. Each story chapter costs you about 60 diamonds to get anywhere. Do the math, that‚Äôs some serious cash. Other similar apps are not that greedy and give you ways to earn diamonds. App developers take note, make some changes.
title: Bring back diamond rewards for ad watching!

review: This app is great. I love both this app and the app ‚ÄúEpisode‚Äù, but they are very different. Episode has endless stories to choose from, but some are NOT well written. This app has well-written authors, and they are actually literate. I recommend this app, especially because it gives a generous amount of tickets to read throughout the day. It would be a 5-Star app IF there were more stories. Also, there aren‚Äôt many ‚Äúchoices‚Äù that don‚Äôt involve tickets. That‚Äôs the downside, but the reads make it worth while.

The books are short and sweet and keep me pretty hooked so far. The only downfall is not being able to choose more interesting story lines due to the need of having enough gems to purchase dialogue and outfits and such. I get that the app needs to earn money, but gems and tickets to open more chapters should be able to earned a little easier.
title: Intriguing!

review: This is pretty good, I would say. The stories are good and pretty detailed, but I‚Äôd say they also fail in a lot of areas. Like for instance, in choices, or episode, they give you the choice of multiple lovers, male and female, but in here, you‚Äôre stuck with one. I do love how earning diamonds are a lot simpler than choices, so you don‚Äôt have to keep wasting your money just to get a good story. One thing that does bug me a lot about this story app, is all the misspelling, repeats, and name errors. But if you can look past that, the stories are great.
title: Okay

review: Wide variety of stories. At the beginning you got an extra 2 tickets for everyday you played like most games but it only lasted a week and stopped now you have to wait thirty mins for a ticket luckily you can get 2 in an hour and the timer starts once you begin the chapter. Also some of the chapters are so short that it seems like a waste of a ticket. I think it would be awesome to replay the chapter or book without having to pay a ticket. Those options would be great or have a unlimited ticket play for $7.99 a month like other games like this.
title: Fun

review: I‚Äôve tried several times over the course of three months to download and play this game and unfortunately I‚Äôve never been able to get it to do anything other than load. title: Highly irritated

review: I really like the stories and the art as well as the relative easiness to get gems. But I have mixed feelings about the Spin-the-Wheel. I'm grateful that you get five spins an hour but it's super annoying that it's rigged to only land on four spots. The spot where you get nothing, the spin-again, the +1 diamond, and the +2 tickets. And you get a very small reward for you five spins, if a reward at all. It never lands on any of the big wins, and I think that's really annoying tbh. Also, it should charge up to at least 3-4 tickets and not just two.
title: iss aight

MC are always have broken issues that take too long to resolve.  Ending on stories are not making sense.  Good app overall but always wait for finished book. VIP IS A good monthly purchase.
title: Very good app

review:
They lure you thru choices ,give a fair number of diamonds for your 1st purchase then drastically reduce the # of diamonds   you get and every choice costs diamonds.  

It cost $30 to get thru one story,even though I skipped decisions a lot. 

I‚Äôm irritated  I let myself get sucked in because I love a good romance. 

There is a  built in psychological compulsion to read  more of the story & the reader will feel like they ‚Äúhave‚Äù to make those ‚Äúimportant‚Äù and ‚Äúcritical‚Äù decisions or they will ‚Äúlose‚Äù what they have emotionally & mentally invested into it. 

You could easily spend a hundred dollars before you knew it, on just 2 stories.  I simply cannot justify spending that much money on a story.  In my mind you‚Äôre better off buying a regular fiction book for $15 to enjoy for a weekend.  Or maybe a role playing game , where at least that way you get hundreds of hours of entertainment for like $60.
title: Huge money pit

The only reason I even downloaded this app is because it was the only way I was allowed to remark on the ads for it being blazed all across every game that I play.

I have young grandchildren who occasionally look over my shoulder while I am playing games and I do not believe that they should be exposed to such smut. 

This is a game that I personally would never be interested in, but even if I were, it should be advertised in a different manner to protect innocent children from seeing it. They will have many, many years to deal with adult things once they become adults. Let them be innocent babies while they are babies.

title: great writing and all,, but-

review: The stories are good and engaging, but you need to have gems for a lot of the cool stuff and if you want to choose certain choices. It‚Äôs a real bummer when you don‚Äôt have any. And you have to wait a very unfair and annoying amount of time once you run out of tickets in order to play more chapters. Another bummer. If you‚Äôre fine with spending $100 to get the best outfits, be able to choose the best options, and play a story without waiting 2 hours between chapters, then yeah, this game is 5 stars. But for people who don‚Äôt want to do that, 2 stars is fair for this game.
title: Good game, but...

review:
From basic spelling and grammar mistakes to cliche, watered down plots full of cardboard characters and bland dialogue, the stories in this app leave a lot to be desired. Reading them felt like reading an edgy thirteen-year-old‚Äôs fanfiction filled to the brim with all the wish fulfillment your preteen heart could ever desire. 

If there‚Äôs any praise I can give this game, it‚Äôs that it‚Äôs generally pretty generous when it comes to diamonds and tickets. Although that doesn‚Äôt mean it isn‚Äôt next to impossible to play a good route without coughing up some cash.

All in all, just save your money. You can find a far more polished experience in an app like Choices.

And now we also need vip to make choices in stories‚Ä¶ YALL are just eating up peoples money.. like please do better.

review:
Far too many ads in this ap and while you do get diamonds for watching the ads, they are nowhere near enough to allow you to do very much in the game.
Choices can cost 12-17 diamonds, watching ads earns 4 or 5 diamonds.
If you want to actually do anything in the game your only realistic option is to spend money buying diamonds.
Gets even more expensive when you use diamonds to make a choice, and a few minutes later you‚Äôre presented with another choice to continue with the choice you made that will cost you even more diamonds.
Due to the expense involved in this ap I am uninstalling it, and would suggest the developers stifle their greed before they lose more users of an otherwise excellent app.
I not recommend this ap unless you have deep pockets and are willing to spend money.

This ap would have received 5 stars from me if it were not for the above points.

However, there are two things that annoys me and hope this will get fixed. If this does, I will give 5 stars. The first annoying thing is I get kicked out of the app constantly. Before I get kicked out I was able to read at least two chapters but now I can‚Äôt read a book or click on anything. It‚Äôs very annoying and I hope this will get fixed. 

The second annoying thing is how I can‚Äôt remove books from My Books. I wish to remove them since I don‚Äôt want it to clutter. 

Other than that, it‚Äôs a great app. For now this is a 3 stars.

review: It was fun. My only issue is that every option costs 17 diamonds and that‚Äôs ridiculous. And I get that you want to make profit from making your users buy diamonds with their credit/debit card but that makes me want to delete this game which I actually just did. I was so excited to see the end of my story but I‚Äôm not going to spend $5 to get 20 diamonds that will be used on one option. Then have to spend more money for another option in the future. I won‚Äôt recommend this to anyone for this reason. Maybe make the options less then 17 diamonds and I‚Äôd reconsider.
title: Diamonds/cost to buy more diamonds

review: The game itself is amazing. The story's are well written. The characters well drawn and animated. My only problem is the excessive amount of diamonds you have to spend in order to do something any person with common sense would do. Every 5 seconds you have to spend 17 diamonds to just be a decent human being to someone or have an opinion in something. I understand paying to make a big decision or get an exclusive scene once a chapter or so but this is a little much....
