title: Ehhhhhhh...

review:
In daughter of hades I noticed many mistakes. Just for the record I‚Äôm a huge Greek geek. So here are somethings I saw:
‚Ä¢The names of demons aren‚Äôt gonna be Adrian or Kyle those are modern, they‚Äôll be called something like Charon or Echidna.
‚Ä¢Heaven and hell are NOT real in Greek mythology there is only the underworld, but there are sections in the underworld for good and bad souls.
‚Ä¢Hades is not red with horns and wings that is Satan not hades.
‚Ä¢I‚Äôm confused on this one the character you play can be a goddess or demigoddess depending on the mother. If her mom was mortal and died her soul would be there so they would know each other. If she was immortal like a creature or goddess then she can‚Äôt die, which leads me to my next comment.
‚Ä¢If her mom was a goddess the only reasonable person would be Persephone whom is not dead and is only gone for autumn and winter to visit her mother Demeter.
title: Did you even research?

review: I‚Äôve been enjoying the books for awhile now and each and every book I read has me wanting more. title: Truly addicting

review: I really love the stories in this app but HATE the amount of diamonds it takes to make it a good story. I understand needing to make money but the developers are quite greedy here. It shouldn‚Äôt cost $100 to get one good story with all the diamond choices. Either lower the amount needed or cut down the amount of premium choices. I like the app Choices because they‚Äôre longer stories with only 1-2 diamond choices per story. You‚Äôll get more readers in the long run if you let more stories be great without spending so much money.
title: Conflicted

review:
I understand that the majority of Apps have in game purchases, I feel this app though...it‚Äôs ridiculous. I have enjoyed the stories with what I can read of them without having to spend my paycheck choosing all the options I want. I would read through many more stories if the gem choices weren‚Äôt so, for lack of a better word, stupid. 

I tried to work through but earning gems is time consuming and I don‚Äôt have the time to sit through ADs all day for one special quest.
title: I can‚Äôt get behind the gems.

review: Really great stories but you can‚Äôt do hardly any premium choices because you have to save for the final episode. It takes up so much storage on your phone and you should be able to completely delete the data from doing on story or someway to restart but keep your gems. Also if you log in when you already did some chapters or earned gems, it deletes everything including your place in the story.
title: Could be better

review:
So I loved it in the past, because though it‚Äôs clearly a money grab app, the choices didn‚Äôt cost THAT much (still expensive but you had some options). The new stories though? You will spend $25 at least to make decent choices, and probably more. And they are forcing you to use stars to get any enjoyment of the story. 17 stars for any plot continuation or fun. Choices are literally things like 17 stars: listen to him or 0 stars: act like a jerk. They actually use wording like that! 

RIP decent choices app, you‚Äôve been resurrected as a zombie money grab that‚Äôs 100% not worth your time.
title: Beware $$$$$$

review: I love the stories but the tickets are a problem. When waiting for tickets, the first one takes an hour and a half and the second one takes two hours. Unfortunately, I could wait five hours for two tickets only to discover that I have no tickets and have to wait another two hours for one ticket unless I purchase them. If this problem didn‚Äôt occur, this would be a fabulous app.
title: Great but slightly disappointing

review: I truly used to love reading these stories and typically pay for games and apps that I use and love, however, I feel like I used to get more rewards in this app and now it‚Äôs pay up for choices that might end up happening anyway. It‚Äôs starting to feel more nickel and diming. There are so many choices per chapter that use diamonds (12+ diamonds) that it‚Äôs just not worth it anymore. The cost of the actual books on kindle are much cheaper than what the app makes you pay. Makes me sad!

And also the genres drama, thriller, and reality aren't even in my thing... there's only young adult, fantacy, horror and some other stuff I don't feel like naming right now.

review:
I think the biggest reason I can‚Äôt go through this app is because of the lack of diversity for the female main players. As an Asian American, I can‚Äôt find a playable character that looks like me. It‚Äôs pretty disorienting and makes the game feel less authentic.

Not withstanding the fact that the theme of damsels of distress, women who are forced into romantic situations because of personal struggles with handsome yet possibly unhealthy men, is pretty old-fashioned and a little cringe-worthy. Where is Daenerys? Where are the empowered women who know they have a choice?
title: Diversity Issues

review: I used to love chapters because it was easy to get diamonds and you could make most of the really important choices without paying anything, which is why I switched to chapters over episode. But now in the end you always have to pay for the final big choice and if you don‚Äôt pay you don‚Äôt end up with the guy and it just makes the whole story dumb because what was the point? The only good thing about chapters now is how quick the lives replenish. But I don‚Äôt think I‚Äôm gonna play again because these new endings really kill the game.
title: Used to be Great

review: I like. It‚Äôs interesting. I stopped playing this app because its pay to read meaning I can only get more diamonds with purchases. But I made three premium choices and without paying. I signed it, watched an ed. There are no ways to get more without paying and I like that. They should use more and take advantage of the ads
title: So far

review: This would be a fairly cute interactive story app if it were actually interactive. All of the major choices cost you money / diamonds (which you basically have to pay for) and sometimes when you do get to make a free choice, the story is like ‚Äúyeah... never mind. Let‚Äôs just go with the other choice.‚Äù I feel like I have zero control over the decisions and storyline. I could get the same satisfaction and experience from looking up free romance stories written by pre-teens on random websites.
title: Basically no choices.

review: I really love this game. Every book I‚Äôve read is so interesting and different in its own way. There was one book ‚ÄúHis‚Äù which was cliche and cringey but the story could‚Äôve been better if the author put more effort in developing relationships within the characters. DOWNLOAD THIS APP. You will not be disappointed, unless you hate happy endings and the basic boy meets girl, falls in love.
title: GIVE IT A TRY !!

review:
Total ripoff, like ridiculously expensive; too many ads, and they‚Äôre glitchy; paying for outfits is insane (at least let us keep them for other scenes/stories); too few LGBTQ+ stories. Racist, misogynistic, sexist, genderist, and bigoted all around. The writing used to be okay sometimes too, but it‚Äôs insufferable now.

They should also just come out and call this a BDSM themed app; I get it some folx are into that, but nearly every story incorporates it now, and not everyone is into it.
title: Awful stories, bad writing, money grab

review: The stories in Chapters are wonderfully written; however, their quality is drastically undermined by how many Diamond choices there are per chapter. Diamond choices typically require players to spend real money and should be relegated to Premium Outfit Choices/Exclusive Scenes, NOT everyday, reasonable choices that allow the story to progress naturally. Having to pay money just so that a character will interact respectfully is manipulative and unfair to loyal readers. If this does not change soon, I will be sticking with Episodes and Choices.

review: I like this game. Just a few complaints..almost all of the good options cost a ridiculous amount of diamonds and the price for diamonds is steep. $4.99 for 60 diamonds when every other choice is 12-17 diamonds is a bit much. And whoever does the writing for this really should learn to double check their spelling. More then once I have been distracted by a wrong or misspelt word. And more then once the name I choose was not the name used by the characters.
title: Fun..but!

review: I really enjoy the stories on this app and the choices that can be made for the characters. I like that you receive more diamonds for the accomplishments and that sometimes you get a diamond for a choice that you choose. The stories are also very well written, makes you want to know what happens next!
title: Love the app

review: So I wanted something fun to read so I got the app but some stories have the name already in the game different from what you may choose like Prince with benefits, trying to watch the videos at the end of the chapter especially homescapes and fortnite either would not provide a gem after completed or just completely shut the whole app down, and would not reload. It needs to be thoroughly scrubbed fixed and updated before the app tried to continue as it is.
title: Lots of glitches

review: The writing for most of the stories is pretty meh, I don‚Äôt know if it‚Äôs because they‚Äôve been adapted from novels or because the writing is just lacking. It definitely isn‚Äôt worth all of the money you have to spend to get diamonds for the options that would make it a half way decent story. It would be cool if there were more ways to earn diamonds, or if diamond based options would cost less since there are SO many through out each chapter.
title: Meh writing, too expensive.

review: Dozens of stories to choose from makes up for the lack of selective topics the books fall under. Some choices made during the stories really effective certain outcomes cost so be carful on how much and when you spend. The app is a great way to spend time if you have virtually nothing going on.
title: Fine pick.

title: Love this game but...

review: I think this is one of the better story apps, however the value of the diamonds are in no way appropriate or fair! I think it would be better to have an option of buying single stories rather than limiting actions throughout the story. It‚Äôs a shame because I would be much more willing to pay money if that was the case.
title: Great story app but very expensive

review: Honestly it would be better if they gave more diamonds when completing a story for those of us that literally don‚Äôt have the money to spend on it. I‚Äôd rather feed my son honestly. The stories are addictive but not much fun do to no gems to choose anything exciting. Almost makes me not want to go further. My suggestion is give more diamonds when completing chapters. title: It‚Äôs ok

First off you only get 5 tickets to start off with and I assumed if I waited I would get 5 more. NOPE!! You get 2 tickets after 4 hours of waiting?! 

Second, every time I start a story an ad pops up, every time I end a story an ad pops up. 

Third, the good choices cost way to many diamonds and then you have to buy more and a pack of 20 which is $2.15 with tax will only get you one choice. I think choices should cost between 3-4 diamonds. 

I will give some good news even though these stories are just like all the others I like the graphics a little better here. 

If the first 3 issues could be taken care of this would be a great game. I get it that money is what they want; then they should just charge $1.99 to purchase and then let it be read all you want.
